050004.question: How did you adopt to sticking to schedules and since when do you live life according to schedules and how to make a good schedule and do schedules help in sorting a messed up life?
050004.answer: i typicaly go through the 12 circles of hell, in order, one by one, and then i am informed that i am supposed to go around another time, and then once i get done with that round i discover the next circle after that which is labelled "14th circle, circle of success" but the problem with that is, because there is no circle labeled 13, the one labeled 14 is actually the 13th. which is the circle of failure. but because i think it's circle 14, i actually stay on it until i have forgotten about success and start to enjoy failure, then i venture to the next circle hoping i may find more failure, unexpectedly arriving at the circle of success around feb 2014 is when it really started working for me. since then many different schedules have succeeded and failed, and some of them have stayed around for quite a long time it requires a level of extreme reasonability, juxtaposed with extreme ambition. a combination that is almost too paradoxical to ever exist yes

050088.answer: i go on a binge searching through all the textual writings i've done, and start finding ones that i think would be ok to put on the site now (dated according to when they were written). then i get hooked doing this process for maybe 48 hours, then i realize, because it's all dated in the past, it doesn't matter how many hundreds of never-before-seen pieces i dump on there, someone's still going to immediately accuse me of 'never updating the page.' so instead of putting all the stuff there immediately and then having it quickly become true that i 'don't update it,' i queue them up and release 1 each day, so at least no one will ever be right when they accuse me of not updating the page regularly

050104.question: how did you get good at singing? was it kind of a natural gift or did you have to practice it and get good technique down before you sounded nice. take us down the path of your singing journey.
050104.answer: it was kind of the last instrument i learned. also kind of necessary, unless i wanted to rely on another person to deliver my musical dreams. at a certain point i got serious about it and started recording myself playing keyboard / singing, on an extremely regular basis. none of the technical 'breathing' advice (or any other technical advice) ever made sense to me, i knew it was probably good advice but i was never capable of following it. breathing is too linked to thinking (not like thinking about your breathing, but like when you think about other things, you breathe based on your thoughts). one thing i discovered very quickly is that the only good moments i was ever able to achieve were when i was improvising the lyrics. the singing suddenly became good (sometimes) when i did that. similar phenomenon to why improvised acting always sounds so much more genuine than scripted (unless the actor has some kind of magical miracle technique, which some do). but the other thing, separate from that, is just simply the more you sing the better you get. and then of course when recording written material, i can do as many trillions of takes as i want and edit with an iron fist. and still in time you get better just from doing it. so that's pretty much how it went, and then particularly during 2015 i improved quite a bit from doing all those vines with singing in them. but sometime around 2018 i suddenly started to think i had damaged my voice, because there was a certain scratchiness that would keep coming back, and i realized that i had probably been pushing too hard to get certain high parts, on cycle mode, just hammering away at really hard takes, over and over and over again, etc.... and i also heard a rumor that 'clearing your throat is bad' (this is actually true) and i had NEVER known that until last year. and that is something i've been doing it all my life. so finding out it's harmful made me very concerned. i got my voice checked by a voice doctor and he said it's fine. but a few things i've learned since then, which have helped a lot: first of all, i have trained myself to stop clearing my throat (was difficult for the first few days but i quickly got used to it). my recording technique changed, i now do much fewer takes at a time, and i actually sit down and edit on the spot, and throw out what i don't like, which gives me a chance to rest and it also makes the process much faster. this was also necessitated when i made the dramatic switch to the 2 week process from what had been 8+ weeks, but it not only helped the speed tremendously but was also much better for my voice. and the other change i made was i started doing this repeatedly (up a halfstep each time) over the course of a 10-15 minute morning walk. it became such an instinctive habit that i actually do this now unintentionally almost everywhere i go

050232.question: what word would you prefer used to describe your lyrics that emphasizes how they're different from most songs? 050247.question: For a social studies project, we have to make or include a video on the berlin airlift in our presentantion. We thought it would be a great idea to make it bill wurtz style. 050247.answer: the only way i learned to do that kind of thing was to engage in a rigorous schedule of short videos (4 per week) starting about like this, for almost an entire year, gradually improving, then took a month break and then started doing it again for about another year. then i was ready to attempt something longer. then had to spend 3 months making it, but if i didn't have those previous 2 years experience i never would have had any idea what the hell i was doing

050253.question: did you have music lessons growing up or did you just figure out how to write and understand music just through listening because i can only ever write music with basic chord progressions and time signatures but i'd love to be able to write some more complicated stuff. love your music !!
050253.answer: briefly but i had a habit of running away after the first lesson, due to inconsolable excitement you'll want to pinpoint the origin of your desire to do 'complicated.' all the answers will be right there. for example, if you heard a piece of music by jembolayah thurstongoeld, and thought 'wow i really love this, and it sounds complicated', then you're gonna wanna go ahead and listen to that a little further, and start to see what it's all about. OR, on the other hand for example, if your desire to do 'complicated' actually came from a feeling of excitement you had by SEEING a very complicated looking piece of music on the page, then i would suggest you go through that piece and learn all the notation in it, and then get a blank page and start to put all those notational pieces together in a very complicated looking order

050257.question: 3.26.19 8:04 pm I HAVE STAFF PAPER. next step pls
050257.answer: almost every song has a "beat," which is like a steady pulse like a ticking clock (although at a different speed, depending on the song). same thing your metronome creates for you. it is what you tap your foot to. listen to some songs and make sure you can identify this beat. actually, most music uses groups of 4. so you should probably be able to group them in groups of 4 and count them in groups of 4 just the same way. go through 10 or 15 songs and try to find the beat (you should find it with most of them, possibly all of them) and then see if you can get them to comfortably be in groups of 4. (this should work very well for most of the songs). let me know if this works for you

050306.question: I don't know much of anything about music theory. But I can compose tunes pretty easily, and I can very intuitively tell when some series of notes are good, or when some are bad. I've come up with this idea of composition that models songs/melodies based on the attention they gather from the listener (attention being used, for lack of better word), which seems like a promising way of writing/thinking about songs. A part of me wants to ignore modern music theory and reinvent the wheel as a means of making more unique music, another part of me says that maybe that's a bad idea. These parts of me are getting very upset, and they're calling each other VERY rude names. Can you help settle the dispute?

050609.question: I've gotten relatively well with identifying melodies and what not, but get absolutely floored with trying to find chords. What would you suggest for me to get better at identifying chords?
050609.answer: go through about 50 of your favorite songs, and identify them with brute force. quickly unpause/pause (or nowadays you can edit to loop a tiny fraction of audio very quickly) and just pick it out note by note and put it together. write down all the chords to a song (in time, with bar lines, etc.)..... once you do this for about 30 or 40 songs, i think you will find that you don't have to search for the individual notes anymore. ... maybe not even pause it at all. After about 100 more songs, you probably won't even have to listen to the song, you will be able to do it from memory. after about 1000 songs, you will probably be able to hear someone singing the melody for a song you have never heard before, without hearing the chords, and figure out what the chords should be. after 10,000 songs, you should be able to play along with them on the first try, never having heard the song before, and have them think you already knew the song

050688.question: i had an anagram-related ethical dilemma yesterday and was wondering what you'd have done in my situation so i have more insight next time something similar happens. i was recertifying my first aid training for the 1939545th time and i was bored out of my skull, so i took a pen and the little manuals they give you and started writing possible anagrams next to the chapter headers. there were lots of wild ones, but i think "bone, joint, and muscle injuries" ---> "boner juice slut, join me and sin" was my favourite. but then!!!!! at the end of the course!!!! THEY ASK FOR THE MANUALS BACK. nobody told me that would happen and the manuals have always been ours to keep at every other certification i've ever attended. so it's like, do i return this and never train with the first aid company again (i have very distinctive handwriting that matches the handwriting on my registration form), or covertly try to steal the manual? i tried the latter but a classmate saw and gave me a dirty look so i ended up returning it and shoving it into the middle of the pile. i still don't know whether that was the correct decision. my worst fear is that the next person reading that manual won't realize the anagrams are in fact anagrams, and will just think i wrote "boner juice slut, join me and sin" over the chapter title for no reason. anyway what would the best course of action have been? do you have any advice for future similar instances of this? thanks
050688.answer: you should put a bracket around the source text, explain in a slightly different font "re-arrage these letters, to get this" and have arrows pointing accordingly. i think anyone reading that can surely be greatful that you've just shown them a pleasingly good time, high brow at that

050703.question: How do I deal with thinking that everyone sees me as stupid? Like to me, how others see me is more important than how I see me. Whenever I think I'm annoying someone or if someone is ignoring me (even accidentally), I feel like everyone hates me and everyone sees me as that annoying, incapable, retarded kid that they wish they could just be rid of. It's feels like nobody cares about me except for me and I have a hard time with that myself if I think I'm just an annoying or even painful thorn to everyone else. And I'm not even sure if I really am that but how can I stop thinking that I am like that if I actually am not?
050703.answer: actually, check to see if they're stupid how do you see them do you like these people do you care about them what is their thorn status? (thorn, not a thorn, etc) have you checked this use the 5 finger rule. over the course of the day, see if you can notice 5 other people who actually have these negative qualities that you've been fearing in yourself. the purpose of this is to turn you into a judge of other people, and then after having some experience judging other people, it may give you an insight about how judging minds work, and therefore you will be able to better understand how or if you have been being judged

050798.question: I have basic video editing software that I have been using to make videos for my music. Problem is, I find the way I use this software to be not unique to me in style. I use it to layer colors and text and images and such. I know I am very inspired by you, but I don't know if what I am doing is copying you or just doing what I can with what I have. It bothers me that the word copycat is being used by some people to describe how your style might be influencing others. But I dont know if it's bothering me because i know i should feel bad about not having an entirely original video aesthetic or if the word just doesnt seem fair to others who are doing their best with tools. Making the music takes time, making the videos takes time, somehow this way of making videos just feels so intuitive. Like it's the most effective and efficient way to make content that is of some quality. I'm not sure how to feel about it. Would you advise me to steer clear of this way of editing? I get a bit panicky when I think of turning up the different dial because I dont know how to conceptualize another video style that feels like it has quality to it but doesnt take forever to make (using only my simple tools). Am I screwed? Part of me does feel bad because I feel like if I'm good enough I should know what to do about this problem.
050798.answer: all you need to do is rotate the waterfall of energy you have poured into this rumination, and instead direct it straight into the project

050993.question: bill I feel like I build things up to mean more than they have to, and it's sorta tiring me out. I mean I make out everything anyone does or says or anything I do or say or anything anyone makes to be something powerful enough and big enough to change the world-but people tell me that's not how it works, that I can't change the world, and nothing else really can either. Well if that's true, what's even the point anyway? And if it's not true, and every action you take has the potential to change your life as well as billions of others, how do you take the right actions? Thabks.
050993.answer: if you feel like every bit and piece of this universe has worlds full of meaning in it, you are right. if you are encountering skepticism or disapproval from others, it might not be that they disapprove of this idea, instead it might be an indication that they feel you are going slightly overboard in the way you are presenting yourself currently. if you have big monumental ideas of change for the world, sometimes it's better to not reveal too much until you've already made some tangible progress. otherwise you may earn a reputation of talking more than you can accomplish. don't let that stop you from actually following through with your ideas

051069.question: let's say that i desperately wanna make my own music, just as you are, but i have absolutely no experience in making my voice sound remotely good. i've got good ears and pitch and everything, but the voice just sounds bad and the technique is nonexistent. how do you think i could at least get my voice to a good baseline which i could expand on throughout my life, in like a solid two months? i know "just do it a lot" is a great answer here, but how do i "just do it" well enough that i can make solid progress along with that? i think i know how this works for physical instruments which i can observe the mechanics of in front of my eyes, but the voice is too obscure, where should i even start? i can feel myself dipping into that 13th level of suffering
051069.answer: this is similar to what i went through, because i am working from the same starting point as you. but you will already be better after 1 month. and at 2 months you will be a little better. and at 3 months you will be better. so the 'baseline' you are working with is actually right now, that's your starting point. 2 months from now will be the middle. unless you stop singing entirely after 2 months. for specifics on technique, for some reason no professional vocal technical advice ever made any sense to me until many years later, and much of it still doesn't. i found that the voice is so deeply connected with life itself that it was almost impossible for me to think directly about most of the things professionals tell you to think about. so i had to find much more abstract tricks. one of the most important tricks i learned was to improvise the lyrics. and for scripted material, try to do it like you are terrified of joe jackson whipping you

051112.question: 4.21.19 1:25 am what do you mean by improvising the lyrics? For your own songs? Other songs? Any songs? And what do you find beneficial about this?
051112.answer: making them up as you go along you could make up a totally new song, or you could start with an existing song and then do it all wrong/different that's when you discover what your singing voice can really do. real life is unscripted. 99.9% of our talking is spent unscripted. it is automatically genuine when you are making it up. the 'weird challenge' is to do scripted material. even the best actors in the world still sometimes sound fake doing this. it is significantly more difficult to find a genuine voice when doing scripted material (spoken or sung) whereas the genuineness is pretty much there by default when you are making it up. for example try reading a book out loud. then compare that to how you normally sound when you are talking to real people throughout your day. you'll see which one is more genuine. unless you happen to be an awesome voice actor in which case maybe the written one might sound totally bang-awesome, but actually still probably fake. unless you've really got the seasoned touch of 1,000 ninjas

I'm putting this deadline because this is a deadly serious thing that i've probably been needing to do for awhile but I have been swamped with trying to figure out how to make content. 051199.question: Hold on I'm confused. I get that maj7's are the root + third + fifth + seventh notes in a major key (at least I think), for example Cmaj7 = C E G B. But then what are the 7's? Because I know that something like C6 is the root + third + fifth + sixth, (C E G A), so then why isn't C7 C E G B? Is this the same with other numbers (eg, ninths, fourths, elevenths)? Also was does add mean? (Eg Cadd11) and how does it differ from not an add (eg C11). Thanks.
051199.answer: C7 is actually an abbreviation for 'dominant 7th' don't ask me why it's called dominant, i suspect it was popularized by a person named dominant. Or you could think of it as an abbreviation for C(b7) just a weird quirk of the history of the language. kind of like "doubt" has a silent b, or how 'invaluable' actually means valuable. oops yes but in this chord symbol language, if you just say 9 it is assumed to include the 7 also. Cmaj9 = Cmaj7(9). Cmin9 = Cmin7(9). C9 = C7(9) it means do it with no 7. but i think the one you mentioned might be more normally called add4

051325.question: 4.26.19 10:16 pm One big thing I've learned from you is to take my work seriously and become a librarian in terms of not letting any ideas fall through the cracks and keeping everything organized. This has been a huge help for me because I'm starting to be very encouraged by a huge growing library, and also starting to see some patterns and directions in all these little ideas, and all this helps me come up with new ideas to fill in the gaps. The part that I'm having trouble with though is the part where I'm supposed to work on a song and "don't switch to a different one until you've made significant progress"? Another fun issue that I've been dealing with for years, is re-writing songs. When I do go back to try to expand upon old ideas and fragments, I wind up making changes to the original idea and not adding anything new.. Sorry, this is long.. but I just wish I had more finished 'products' to show for all my little ideas and stuff.
051325.answer: ah, you must complete the 12 levels of suffering, then the 13th which is the unlucky last and final level; the reason it is unlucky is because after you finish it you will be informed that there is another level after that

051370.question: am i allowed to call myself autistic (or say i ~identify with the autism spectrum~ or what fucking ever) based on years spent getting to know autism and myself, and a sense of "holy shit i finally get it now, this diagnosis is actually a rly useful framework for me to understand why i am like how i am" or do i have to wait until i get to the top of a provincial healthcare waitlist and find a doctor who agrees with me? because i'm getting pretty fucking tired of the latter hahahahah aaaaaahhh ah ahanaha haha
051370.answer: any of the traits fount in an autistic diagnosis are well within the range of 'human' style traits and behaviors. they may not be traits that everyone has, but they are still vastly human traits. thousands and hundreds if not zillions of people have those traits. but if you are waiting for a doctor to write you permission to be yourself, i would pose the question: who do you think writes the doctors permission to be themselves? i'll tell you the answer: it's larger doctors. the point of this story is to see if you can locate the largest doctor and see if you can get them to write you permission to become a very large doctor, not the largest but possibly second largest

051427.question: one of my biggest problems when combining melody with chords is that ending a melodic phrase by going M3 -> 1 is one of the strongest sounding melodic resolutions, but the strongest harmonic resolutions I know (V7->I, bII7->I, iv6->I) all do not work well with the M3rd of the tonic chord included (at least when the blending is clear enough to hear the dissonance). I know V13 is a thing, but I always think that sounds weird unless the 7th is lower than the 13th, which usually makes the chord sound muddy. The best way I've found is iii with the 5th of the tonic scale in the bass, but that never is quite as satisfying as I want it to be. Do you have a go-to for this situation? I know in And The Day Goes On, you just did a I chord with the 5th in the bass going to a normal I chord with lots of voices moving down and it totally worked there but like iii/5th it leaves me with a bit of harmonic blue balls when I try to apply it in general.
051427.answer: if you are really saying the 3 to 1 melody is the strongest thing around, then surely you must have Heard it somewhere. how was it done there? i can't tell which part you mean you mean Emin over G, or Emin over B? if Emin/G to Cmaj feels too lame and weak, you're gonna want to swap out the mid-range G for F. so you have G bass, then F B E over it. that's G13 but maybe you haven't tried it that way? that can be made crunchier if you also add Ab in there. that might actually remind you of the 1930s. but none of this means anything without the entirety of what else is happening in the song. most songs are not just those 2 notes, no words, etc

051471.question: 4.30.19 10:27 am It's like how you have several parts of your brain (limbic system, frontal lobe, occipital lobe, etc.) and even if some of them act independently of the others, "you" are still "aware of" what they do (create emotion, make judgements, process vision, respectively). And, in the case of, say, the occipital lobe, even if the neurons never receive signals from each other directly, the lobe is still "aware" of what the neurons do (aware meaning affecting behavior. In this case, what the neurons do determines how the lobe behaves, i.e. what it communicates to the other parts of the brain, and so we say the lobe is "aware of" the neurons' actions. Same applies for part of your brain affecting "you"). The ABC scenario is a just simple example of this Russian-nesting-doll of consciousness, where higher levels are aware of the thoughts of lower levels, but not vice-versa. My theory is that, just as a human has independent parts yet feels like a single experiencing mind and not like millions of tiny neuron minds, so too may there be a higher level of consciousness that feels like me and only me, you and only you, Benedict Cumberbatch and only Cumberbatch, … , and perhaps some non-person thoughts exclusive to the higher-level-consciousness. That's what I mean by everyone is everyone else. By the theory, we are all just one entity that experiences many localized, I-am-me-and-noone-else perspectives. Of course I feel like me, and you feel like you. But that feeling of individual identity does not mean that our experiences are not just the thoughts of one single entity.

051494.question: What's the difference between 2/4 and 4/4? I know 2/4 is like DAH dah DAH dah... etc and 4/4 is like DAH dah dah dah DAH dah dah dah... etc but you could easily count the ands in 2/4 and have it pretty much the same as 4/4. 051533.question: how many key changes are there in "the moon is made of cheese but i can't taste it"?
051533.answer: let's see, starts in B, then for "crazy" i'd call that a switch to Ab, then back to B (that's 2 changes so far). Remind me etc. would be from key of Db, then from World was younger is from A, so that's 2 more changes there. TV on radio is definitely from Db, then around Stereo/leaves, we're in Bb, then landing on Turquoise we're back in B, so that's 3 more changes. 'Fly around on an airplane' sounds like it would be part of a song in E, then 'business class sec' would be in G, so that's 2 more changes. ants crawl is still G, then the next chord i could make a case for either E, A, or D, but regardless it's definitely a change. then B (turtles.) then on "streets" i would argue Db. and just linearly up from there (Eb, then F, then G.). so that's 6 more changes. then somewhere in the midst of 'church holds the key' it slips into C, so that's 1 more change. Then it goes to garbage land on the last line in the chords, but, the melody is still in C so i don't call that a change. so that's 16 changes if i counted correctly, according to what i think counts as a key change. using for sure 9 different keys, at least

051594.question: so. during reality editing, since you've confirmed you don't watch the entire unedited videos, how do you go about finding the moments you end up actually putting into the final edited vids? if i were doing that kind of thing (and have as long of videos as you, considering if i'm remembering correctly that you have reality videos that can be hours long), i'd kind of skip around the videos trying to find what is good enough to go into the final versions. if that makes sense.
051594.answer: really fast maybe, maybe i'd watch all of 1. but i can't watch all of them all just keep searching and searching and searching and finding things that are 'ok, but i wish i had something better' etc, and eventually i might find something good enough. or sometimes i just start putting graphics on something that i didn't think was that good, and i can sometimes make it become good. or, sometimes i work from a list of things i've gathered when i was earmarking certain things, having done some searching perhaps at a previous more leisurely time yes. when originally going through in 2016 from the beginning (and making the almost the entire 2010-2016 catag), i felt obsessively the need to get to every file, i had up to triple speed playback (adjustable as listening, to catch whatever), and skipping over blank spaces. got pretty good at it, but still it was taking multiple weeks just to get throught the material and bookmark. weeks and months were flying by during this process. so eventually probably around when i got to the 2014 videos (that would be sometime in april 2016 i guesss, having started the project in early feb 2016) i made the decision to start severely skipping files. just sort of going 10 days apart maybe, and clicking into them. Also sometimes deliberately searching for specific important points. this is where it can be an advantage to not do the editing until years later, because then you know what turned out to have future significance and you can assemble more rewarding plot points

051635.question: What does a #### or bbbb in front of a staff/bass clef mean on sheet music??
051635.answer: if it says #### (and it HAS to be on the F, C, G, and D lines) it means play every F, C, G, and D note as F#, C#, G# and D# instead, which for the folks at home means we will be playing in the key of E. If it says ♭♭♭♭ (and it HAS to be on the B, E, A, and D lines) it means play every B, E, A, and D note as B♭, E♭, A♭, and D♭ instead, which for the folks at home means we will be playing in the key of A♭. But when you see the symbols at the beginning, if there are 4 of them like you said, they HAVE to be on those exact lines. otherwise you can send the charts back with some educative instructions

051757.question: 5.10.19 8:02 pm - Okay then, let me show you these words which will convey the virtues of albums. Me personally, I view albums as more like a book or a short story, where each track is a particularly memorable sentence from a chapter that sticks in your head, or a plot twist/intriguing moment or something like that. The whole purpose of an album in my opinion is to create a story that's bigger than just one song could provide, or rather tell one story but with a lot of nuance and detail to it. Instead of taking them on a short journey with one song and trying to pack as much as you can in there, with an album you can give yourself time to think and breathe and tell as much as needs telling and in the time it takes, y'know? Not tryna invalidate your approach to "musical storytelling", but that's the angle I tackle the music-making bull from, anyway.
051757.answer: right, but if you're really gonna put any good amount of twists and turns in it, wouldn't it already be much more than an album?

051847.question: 5.11.19 12:12 pm - Yes, it would be "a good album". Seriously! All the albums that really are worth the candle and aren't just "compilations of songs" already do that, at least in my eyes. Take Daft Punk's Discovery for example, or Janet Jackson's The Velvet Rope. Albums that have so many twists and turns that to share only one song off of it at a time is kind of doing it an injustice. THAT'S a sign of a good album - when you need someone to take in the total package rather than just a singular song. It'd be like taking a chord from a song and just playing that rather than the whole song; sure you can do it, but to get the whole scope of things, you need the entire track. An album should be like that, I feel.
051847.answer: seems like it could be better if it had a little more non-song content to fill it out. at least enough so that calling it an album would be a stretch, and it would be better off called a 'movie' or 'story' or at the very least a 'musical'

051890.question: Hey Bill!!!!! I have to analyse two songs to do with adversity for my English homework and I will be using "just did a bad thing". I'm tired and I've been fasting the whole day. Could you give me at least three poetic devices in your song. Thanks.
051890.answer: 1: not telling you the thing, within the entire first verse, despite telling you i was going to tell you. (that's called deception, it's like a bank loan where they lie to you before you sign it.) 2. fractal-duck form. this can be seen simply in the self-similar nature (even if you just look at it geometrically, pretty much.) of the 1st 8 bars of the chorus ('game' section). the word "take" is the 1st landing point, which happens at the 75% mark of the first 4 bars. then, the echo selfsimilar identical position on the 2x timescale, would be the word "change", which occurs at exactly the 75% mark of the first 8 bars. 3. having nearly the entire contents of 2 lines rhyme not only with each other, but also individually each having almost all of the words in them rhyme (bad glad, and the sad bad etc, dream/scheme lines)

051915.question: 5.15.19 11:35 pm i dont understand why that second part would be true if there have been very great albums that we still call albums
051915.answer: that's fair, i think it just so happens that i don't like any albums, aside from the songs they contain. i have yet to hear one that seems to actually aquire any special quality due to the order of the songs. i've specifically gone searching for this on many occasions, i used to trust that it must be true, but after listening to so many of the most famous albums that are famous for being *great albums*, i actually have unilaterally failed to see anything special about the album as a whole, and still feels like at best it is just a bunch of really awesome songs, and on every album i've ever heard (in proper order) that i can think of, including the ones that are the most famous for being *great albums*, almost every time i still feel like at least some of the songs are in extremely the wrong order. i actually think songs probably go best in different orders on different days, unless you are able to do additional craftwork additionally going far beyond the music, to set up the songs to guarantee it's the right order. to do this i think you'd surely need at least as much connecting tissue (audio AND visual preferably) as could be found in a stage musical, at least. i don't see why you would want to do LESS than that, unless you are really just doing songs. no one seems to ever get what i'm saying on this but that's ok. i live alone

051921.question: It occurs to me that the confusion over the idea of an 'album' is down to a lack of agreement with regards to definition. I think you take the term 'album' quite literally, almost as the term photo album, i.e. a repository for a set of only loosely connected items. Most of the people arguing in favour of a Bill Wurtz album see the album in general as a sophisticated artwork that, in its most successful cases, has not a single note or word out of place and was conceived as a thematic whole, like a novel or a movie, and not as a random selection of songs. All the great albums are apparently random selections of songs, that reveal their inner logic and consistency only gradually, sometimes after many years. Pet Sounds and Rubber Soul fall into this category. You yourself have already made one total masterpiece of an album. Its most satisfying tracklisting (for me) runs as follows: 1) Alphabet Shuffle 2) Outside 3) And The Day Goes O n 4 ) at The Airport Terminal 5) Slow Down 6) Hallelujah 7) Hello Sexy Pants 8) Mount St Helens 9) La De Da De Da De Da De Day Oh 10) Long Long Journey 11) I'm Best Friends With My Own Front Door 12) When I Get Older 13) The Moon Is Made Of Cheese The new album is also shaping up well ( Might Quit, Just Did A Bad Thing). I'm also not overlooking Christmas Isn't Real: it is my personal favourite of all your songs, but perhaps too high-concept to integrate easily into an album. You have lifted the single song and video package onto the level of art form almost single-handedly. Pity us older music lovers who are still attached to our 45 minute programs, preferably broken into two halves. The album was our guiding principle, our mainstay, our educator and friend. No movie or novel (or music video) could ever approximate its awesome depth and breadth of vision. Only the truly great managed to master it as an art form, most crashed inexorably on its treacherous cliffs. Indeed, if you set out to create an album as a work of art you may already have shipwrecked. Its easily the most confounding mainstream modern artistic discipline. It's a shame it is really dying. Perhaps it is already dead?
051921.answer: i am the wrong person to ask about this, because i simply never connected with that format. i also try desperately to avoid dwelling on the feeling that a certain art form is 'dying' because it just seems to abundantly clear to me that artforms are thriving and being born at each and every moment, just as enthrallingly and eagerly as they ever were

051965.question: Have you ever had a social media adiction? I'm dealing with this problem and it seems like the only solution is to unfollow everyone and have a new start. 051965.answer: i think the account(s) and connections are worth saving. but i think you need to start taking more drastic measures to eliminate some of the software (or preferably, hardware even) you may be using to access these sites. in my opinion you should always keep your account. just get a restraining order against the hardware, and work it out so you still have limited hardware for the things you do need. for example, i actually make sure i wake up with my smartphone *OFF* (powered off) but i actually bought a plastic alarm clock, in case i ever need to use that feature

I tried to write in english, being the language of the internet I think, but it's less natural, it just doesn't flow. I wonder if I should just force myself to create in english all the time (the more I do it, the more it becomes natural, right?) or if I should just stick to what comes out of my mind naturally, closer to the music on ma native language. I know the audience shouldn't be a goal, but still, I'm traveling more and more and I always find this frustration of not being able to share my work because of language. Any thoughts about my case? Thank you!!
052033.answer: i think you should keep having fun with english. keep doing french of course, because that's where you are 100% fluent, but you clearly speak english well enough to have loads of fun. some of the best english is actually written by people who are coming at it with a new twist

052154.question: is it possible to have a tempo where the top number is bigger than the bottom number (like 4/3)? If so how can it be executed?
052154.answer: tempos should be only 1 number, but you may be thinking of time signature you'll never see 3 on the bottom the top number is the number of beats in a bar. the bottom number is what kind of note gets the beat. so 5/4 means there's 5 beats in a bar, and a quarter note gets one beat. 3/2 means there's 3 beats in a bar, and a half note gets one beat. if the bottom number is a 3 then i guess you'll have to figure out what 3rd notes are, which i guess you could conclude are triplets, in which case congratulations you now have something that looks exactly like 3/4 except for added fun you have to write the number 3 over every note in the song

052157.question: how many key changes are there in mount st. helens?
052157.answer: let's see, it starts in G, there is a small hint or borrow from another key on "grey" but i really don't think that's long enough to call it a key change. then it doesn't change keys until the first bridge, which starts in Eb for the first half, then from "vacation" it would be in F (this is 2 key changes so far) then "paying them etc" would be in Ab, then back to G for the next verse. this makes 4 key changes so far. during this 3rd verse, it does a similar key slip that happens in the first verse (different key but similar place), but it lasts slightly longer than the one in the first verse, just long enough to declare it a key change maybe depending on who is judging that day. then back to G. so that makes 6 so far. then the second bridge, again to Eb in the first half (7 changes so far total). then on "sun burns out" there could be disagreement on which of those is considered a key change. i feel on 'sun' it seems like we are in Amin for just the moment, then the following chord actually feels like it's coming from the key of Cmin, which i would consider the same key as Eb. so i'd think that would be rude to say it changes to Amin and back for just that 1 chord, but then again on "sun" there is a distinct change. on the other hand, you could argue that they are both coming from the key of C, nah fuck it i guess you have to call that 2 keys. fine so we'll call that 2 key changes for "sun burns out." (that's 9 so far) but you see where this creates chaos in the courts because we've just allowed a single chord to be called its own key, twice in a row. so then it's only fair that we allow it back at the beginning also, for "grey." so that makes 2 extra changes because you'd have to count the change back also. so let me re count, that would be 11 so far, then from "sky" all the way to "goin down", that's all in Bb, so that's 1 more change. so 12 changes so far. then the top of the next verse stays in Bb but quickly slips to G, then the rest of the outvamp is in G which makes 13 changes if you include all the single chord incidents, and maybe 10 if you are more stubborn about including those

052176.question: I wanted to ask you what your secret to success is, but I had the strangest feeling it is not a secret, and there is no hidden formula to become cool, and it's instead just me looking for an easy way out of the mess I'm in. So how do you deal with it when you have to do stuff the hard way, constantly, because hard is the default setting?
052176.answer: i will tell you a good trick in finding what works for you. go on youtube and start watching all the videos you can find about success strategies, etc. then remember the golden rule, which is that everone is absolutely different, and you can be sure you will hear loads of advice which is absolutely contradictory to each other. (that's how you know this method is working .....) then, after watching for a couple days, try to recall which ones made you the most excited, and follow those. they will probably work, as long as you choose the ones that made you go "yeah!" and not the ones that made you go 'meh'

052202.question: Hello! I come from a very cut- throat high school that only cares about their students' GPA and their GPA contributes to whether they enter a good college or not. Coming from this environment, I felt a constant pressure because I was surrounded by hard-driven people that applauds when they see another person's rank goes down so they can move up. Well college decisions released, and unfortunately, I did not get into the college I wanted and for these past few months I felt very worthless because I kept comparing myself to those who got into my dream school. Most students in my school got in and some I question why and how and I started to fall in this wormhole of depression where I think I was not enough compared to other students because my dream school did not accept me whilst they accepted many others that I thought did not care enough about school. I just feel like the whole world is against me because now I would go to school, ashamed to share the college I'm going to and hearing EVERYONE going to my dream college. Everywhere I go, I hear them getting into my dream college and I am truly happy for them, but it just feels like the whole world is ridiculing me. How can I stop this negativity cluttering up my mind? I know this is so unhealthy for me, but when you are constantly reminded of your failure, how do you cope with that? I really wish you see this because no one around me has the answers and I just feel like I am alone in figuring these things out.
052202.answer: a couple of things it is important to remember. 1. college/university education is rapidly losing credibility out in the real world. in other words, as we move into the modern era, it matters less and less to anyone whether or not someone has a university degree. or 2., maybe you feel envious because you think it will socially and culturally be some kind of golden magical time. and that may be true, but as an alternative can i interest you in becoming a traveling poet

052257.question: why traditional grip instead of match grip for playing the drum kit? do you feel there are any advantages/disadvantages of either

052280.question: Can you help explain drum notation to me?
052280.answer: the rhythms work the same, but instead of pitches, each line or space probably represents a different drum/cymbal/percussion item. usually the kick drum goes on the bottom, the cymbals usually go on top, usually with X heads, and the snare usually goes in the upper middle space. sometimes you see special markings above hi hat notes such as "O" or "+" which means open or closed. Which drum/item is which is usually labelled on the left before the start

052295.question: i've been on a devastatingly long break from creating music (6 months at least), and it's absolutely killing me. i just lost it at the height of my career because of an insane amount of pressure (self-inflicted, mostly) to sound good and be an amazing pianist. also, i've been traveling this week and i'm staying in a house with a few other musicians. tonight i heard someone basically hitting the keys and playing with some cute chords, no recording or end goal or anything, just spending time with the instrument. and it filled me with relief and determination. because i guess ive been waaay too much of a perfectionist- and i've been too afraid to make mistakes while playing, to the point of deleting my confidence to even play. but, if this person can just hit some keys at 2 am and still manage to get some enjoyment and meaning from it, fuck what the hell am i holding back for? i forgot why i even fell in love with music: what the fuck is music and how can i make it myself
052295.answer: just put the same amount of energy into the music that you put into writing this. but on the other hand don't forget about writing too, because it seems clear that you already have a lot of energy for that too

052329.question: i have seen two points. one point arguing that destroying every particle in your body and then reforming it would kill the 'you' you but give birth to a new someone who is entirely you and to their knowledge everything continued as normal, but the 'you' you is really gone. The other argument is that this new exact rearrangement of particles is you and would be the 'you' you and everything is fine. I have a hard time with each one but i think i lean towards the idea that the 'you' you won't be there anymore more when it is reformed. i think this idea for some reason blends in with my thoughts about reincarnation. i also think there are extra problems to the situation like, what if when your particles are reformed they form 2 or 3 copies? then, if 'you' you are still around, which one is you? are both you? would it be like a clonal colony hive mind kind of thing? that doesn't make sense to me and damages the argument that 'you' you would be around. if everything is happening, perhaps what we are experiencing in this life happens infinite times. if it does, do 'i' really get to experience that many times? it doesn't feel like that. unless this is the first time and i am in for a big whopping surprise when i die. these things have just been really burning into my brain. any thoughts? thanks for listening. i hope the new video is bringing meaning and joy.
052329.answer: i think this automatically happens to all of us. there is a persistent rumor that says our entire bodies entirely regenerate themselves over the course of several years, implying that you are now a completely different physical body than the one you are born with that would be a mindfuck but we would probably all learn something eventually probably because the possibilities are so vast, it's probably impossible to imagine currently

I don't want to say goodbye to all my life experiences - the things I've done, the things I want to do, the people I love. I'll never know the things people will discover in the far-off future. Thinking about giving that all up makes me want to cry, honestly. I don't want to die. I really REALLY don't want to die!!!! What are your thoughts on this? Any tips

052366.question: is The One a myth? The One being the project that is so interesting that i _want_ to work on it for reasons other than the promise of a paycheck at the end. * * it is maybe important to note that i am typically paid for the sort of projects i do (computer software) even though i also do it as a hobby honestly I go to work and just stare at social media or chase the office dog around the place and generally feel like i can't focus or do anything except for like the two days a month that it becomes clear i will be fired if i don't do at least something. it is somehow more exhausting than i remember working every day being
052366.answer: the _wanting_ part of your mind will never be satisfied. it's all good but you'll always want more. so if you fuel the machine by only 100% _want_, you'll always be more desperate and never satisfy those cravings. the good news is, what is also fun is a little exercise. if you've ever had a fun day in gym class (even just once, maybe when you were playing dodge ball, or maybe even just doing a line dance on that one day) then you'll know what i'm talking about. once you get everything together and take responsibility for this whole thing as a company, knowing that it's your company and it's allowed to do exactly what you want it to do, you may be able to hit that sweet spot and have a fun good time at work, while actually bit by bit bringing yourself the result of your dreams, in carryable packet sized buckets. even though you would have _wanted_ more, it turns out that as with most treats and sweets, it is given its sweetness by its limited daily quantities

052687.question: I am always discouraged by the mixing aspect of music production and not being able to achieve the sound i want. what do i do?

052746.question: hey bill I have a crippling fear of doing bass fills live and my friend who is the guitar player said i have to just do it. how true is this in your opinion/experience?
052746.answer: if you don't wanna do it then you're not gonna do it well. it's like being in a waiting room. if you've been in there for 9 hours, you're gonna wanna go buck wild and flip off the walls and do backflips etc, and this is fine because after 9 hours you should know the shape of that room. But if you are in there for 2 min and then someone says 'ok you gotta start doing flips man' , .....that could be a little risky if you don't know what the room is all about yet. by room i mean the song. once you know a song well then you will be able to take care of the song, and then do all your back flips, and you'll know all the twist and turns of the song so you'll know when you gotta be home by. if you know the song then you're gonna know when and where you have time to have your feet not be on the ground. if you don't know where those bumps are, you could jump at the wrong time and everyone will fall in the river

052748.question: I feel as though you embody a nice balance of both groups in this example: The ceramics teacher announced on opening day that he was dividing the class into two groups. All those on the left side of the studio, he said, would be graded solely on the quantity of work they produced, all those on the right solely on its quality. His procedure was simple: on the final day of class he would bring in his bathroom scales and weigh the work of the "quantity" group: fifty pound of pots rated an "A", forty pounds a "B", and so on. Those being graded on "quality", however, needed to produce only one pot – albeit a perfect one – to get an "A". Well, came grading time and a curious fact emerged: the works of highest quality were all produced by the group being graded for quantity. It seems that while the "quantity" group was busily churning out piles of work – and learning from their mistakes – the "quality" group had sat theorizi ng about perfection, and in the end had little more to show for their efforts than grandiose theories and a pile of dead clay.
052748.answer: a weird thing may happen, where the speed people end up learning how to make better pots by the end, where as the "quality" people are only making 1 pot so they hardly ever got any experience aah, i knew it, i wrote the last part without reading ahead entirely relatable

053281.question: where do I start with learning how to make keyboard accompaniment parts?
053281.answer: learn the melody for "twinkle twinkle little star" (or the alphabet song), in the key of C, and then learn how to play chords C, F, and G. then see if you can figure out which ones to play along to each moment of the melody. the whole song can be done very nicely in this way. see if you can put it together. the 3 chords spelled out are: C major chord is these notes: middle C, then E above that, then G above that. F major chord is these notes: middle C then F above that then A above that. G major chord is these notes: D right above middle C, then G above that, then B above that. You could switch these notes in any order but I've given them to you all staying in a reasonable range. so sing the song through in the key of C (starting on the note C for the first note of the song) and then see which chords of those 3 chords you think feel the best at which parts. see which ones seem to make the song sound the most strongly like itself. should be easy and fun, at least it was for me

053300.question: well, i gotta ask. what's going on that you haven't heard before / seem like mistakes in the Mario Bros. 2 Overworld? i presume it's in the first two lines of chords since the rest is pretty standard
053300.answer: what really made my head explode upon a closer listen, there's 2 things actually. when the bass hits the F, F#, G, A thing, that's like the most cliche figure in the world and it's been in 1000s of songs (especially american 'jazz' popular sort of songs from the 1930s and 40s i suppose?) (and also many nintendo games) and the chords are F, Fdim, C/G, A7. it really blew my mind to hear that the A note on the Fdim chord actually had F natural harmonized under it. that was the worst offender. it just HAS to be F#. now, it's easy for me to sit here and complain, but i must admit, from experience, in some cases you may go in and make it what you think it's supposed to be and it just doesn't work. Sometimes you see these paradoxes where the bass will do it the twisty way and the melody will just completely ignore the twists and do it straight, and for some reason it just works fine that way when you breeze through it. it's one of the great mysteries of life. The other issue, which was a little bit less disturbing but yet still defied all norms of the 'genre', is the A7, which in every fiber of instinct feels like it was supposed to be A7, and the harmony note should have been C#, but in reality they used C. this is not nearly as big a 'crime' as the F and A notes over the F# bass, but yet still common sense and experience of the 'genre' still begs that to be A7, at that point in the song. It really makes you want to wonder if there is some technoligical restriction at play, preventing us from having any melody or harmony notes outside the plain C major scale set. but this is disproved if we take a look at the other section, on the D7 chord, we have F#s right in there. The only other thing i MIGHT be inclined to hypothesize is that the melody and harmony line were written and programmed before the bass was there? and it was planned to be less 'jazz' and more 1, 4, 5 triads. then when the bass came along there was somehow a decision to go more 'jazz' and yet the harmony was not changed to match the bass. This is unlikely and doesn't match nintendo's reputation for perfection especially in these types of genres, they usually absolutely nail this stuff. or again to restate my other theory it could simply be that upon trying the 'correct' 'twisty' harmonies there you would expect, it might have just not sounded right. one of the great mysteries of the universe, but sometimes that is the case. BUT, without constructing a sound-alike and testing for myself, my current hypothesis is that it does weaken the song at those moments to have the notes in there the way they currently are, and i do believe it would be stronger if those were sharped. but i am only about 85-90% sure, short of actually constructing a sound-alike and trying it at tempo and in context

053367.question: There are too many songs so how do i pick which one to record
053367.answer: first put them all in a list. then, go through the list from bottom to top and choose as many songs as you want. be generous, choose songs you would like to record 'eventually.' once you have that second list, don't delay, it will be temping to do round2 and narrow it down to dust until there's nothing left, but don't. count them quickly, and go to random.org and get a random number (set range accordingly) and set it in stone as fast as you can. don't even look up the title just yet ..... just write down the number and let it sink in that your decision is made, and was healthily balanced between random and genuine. This is a summary of many years of negotiations i've had between the 2 ends of this spectrum

053372.question: I have this thing I'm creating and it requires a large amount of knowledge to complete. Of the tasks that need to be accomplished to finish this thing, I (at this moment) only have the skills necessary to complete about 20% of it. Due to advice received from other people, I've spent the last 4 months trying to work with other people who have the other 80% of the skills I need and as a result, I feel like I have wasted the last 4 months of time I could have spent working because I'm no further along in the process than I was before. Each time I find another human who I think can contribute, I end up moving backwards. I think this is because of a few things. 1) they're only focused on what they will get out of it monetarily (which is fair and also achievable with this thing I have begun to create, but their focus on money rewards doesn't accomplish anything). 2) they wait for me to spoon feed the creative process into their brains to fill i n incomp lete holes in the vision instead of trying things themselves. 3) If they do make anything, they protect all parts of it instead of submitting to the creative editing and improvement process. The world is telling me that at some point I will just find these people and that if I keep asking everyone I meet for help on the project, I will eventually finish the thing. BUT. I'm really starting to think that this isn't true and that what the OG creator is telling me is that I need to do this alone. I need to spend the time teaching myself to do the other 80% and then just do it. Now I'm wandering my house feeling angry that this is something I have to do by myself. I really like other humans and it's hard for me to believe that I alone can make something as incredible in real life as what I'm seeing and hearing in my head. Because this is going to take a really long time. And I'm already lonely. But I gotta do it. And I'm crying. Cause I'm scar ed. And it's so much work. Is the next step to teach myself all those other skills? And then once I have an approximate idea of how to use the tools, I start making whatever the best version of the thing I can. And then I start showing it to people? Is that right?
053372.answer: yes but i might suggest not doing the biggest project first. things will flow so much more smoothly if you can integrate the doing and the learning. learn a bit, do a bit. try learning and doing at the same time. the part about working alone, yes, you are absolutely right, you must work alone. that part is true. i remember the pivotal moment my life was changed when i found out that some people are actually built to work alone and it's ok. all it took was to hear an important artist come out and say that's what they do and it's just how they are. then i started looking around and found quite a few other people who are the same way. many many people do great in groups, but, it's important to recognize that many people also work alone. there are advantages and disadvantages to both. disadvantages to working alone are insanely bloated production time, and your brain eating itself. but the advantages are off the wall

053416.question: 6.25.19 7:28 am so, lets say I have a chord made up of the following notes: F-Ab-C-Eb-G-Bb-Eb-G. Having grown up playing music from classical notation (treble cleff and bass cleff) I think my instinct is to split it up as F-Ab-C-Eb in left hand and G-Bb-Eb-G in right hand, so I kind of memorize the two blocks by themself. But once I move to another chord lets say G-Bb-D-F-Bb-C-D-F, I would split it into G-Bb-D-F on left hand and Bb-C-D-F. So instead of memorizing 2 8note chords, i memorized 4 4 note chords, and it always made sense since it felt like memorizing smaller chunks would make it easier. The thing is, when moving from first set of 8 to second set of 8, the checklist becomes twice as long when trying to make the change fast, since I have to run the checklist of 2 4 note chords as opposed to a big one. So my mind is split making sure I got the left hand right and then the right hand right (and with the memorized finger positions). So let's say I have a less than ideal memorized way of placing my fingers on the notes because that's how i first came upon them, then I would just be repeating my mistake everytime simply because thats how i memorized the 2 blocks. But on the other hand if my "mental check list" goes note by note from the bottom up, then my hands might fix the mistake the second time i play by going "ah, that makes more sense how my fingers landed on the notes this time around" and instead of memorizing how to place my hand on them, my hands start learning finger placement instinct in a sense, and i have more mental space to do/think other things. I always thought it was easier to memorize both blocks because, lets say for the second 8 note chord I could memorize Gb7 on left hand and a Bbadd9 on the right hand, both on root position. But I am coming to the realization that seeing them this way may intelectualize the process too much and make me think of music in more math/pattern terms rather than feeling the music. As for the puzzle part, if i just play the right notes and not worry about which hand does which, the hands slowly start gaining instinct of how to play what. And everytime you play them, you're figuring out the finger-placement puzzle again, or atleast starting to make the connection of both hands working as one as opposed to LH does x, RH does y. Another advantage I believe is that when changes need to be made to the voicing they are made to the whole at the same time, and rebalancing voices in the other hand to fit the change becomes easier. Because you don't need to relearn both blocks again and/or how they differ from the previous version of the chord, you just need to solve a new puzzle when playing.Mentally it feels kind of like the first time I started seeing the harmonies in classical music as opposed to just learning the notes and the order they come in at. Way easier to play bach's prelude 1 if you know the chords that are being arpeggiated rather than learning/reading each note by itself as it comes. I thin I am slowly unhindering myself of the limitations of the way I learned to play music as a kid. It just always seemed so intimidating to me seeing people improv 2 handed chords over changes and I thin perhaps they weren't thining of them as 2 separate blocks one for each hand, but as one whole thing. The other advantage to not seeing it as 2 hands I believe is that it's easy to say, well that chord needs one less note, and just play the chord and let the fingers figure out who plays who, as opposed to trying to keep balance or saying "well, there was 4 and 4, now theres 4 and 3, i should probably take one out of the left hand too to make it balanced" when the balance perhaps doesn't lie in number of notes in each hand but simply what the music needs, which might not always makes sense in the pattern/balance-seeking frame of mind. I hope it makes more sense or atleast shows what I'm thinking better. Tl;dr, "Gb7 on left hand, Bbadd9 on right hand" turns into G-Bb-D-F-Bb-C-D-F. First one might make more sense for writing down/analyzing, second might be more instinctive and wont rely on having to make sense of each hand as an individual chord. Like, on the example of the first chord F-Ab-C-Eb-G-Bb-Eb-G, itd be hard to categorize G-Bb-Eb-G as a recognizable chord, perhaps some sort of Eb in first inversion with a doubled 3rd on the top but I want to let my ears do the listening, my fingers the playing and my mind the enjoying instead of intelectualizing it. It may seem I'm saying the newer way im doing it is better but I think maybe it just complements something that's been lacking in my approach to music thus far and a balance must be found as opposed to committing to one way or the other. I find the mind of a piano harmony improvizer intriguing and I hope this new approach makes it less convoluted in my head. It just seems like itll be way easier to improvize when im not trying to first make two independent hand voicings and placing them together as opposed to thining of a big voicing spread through all my fingers (and let them do the chosing of which plays what note as opposed to summoning up some finger positions from the catalogue since my catalogue may be too limited atm. It feels like when playing with this new frame of mind, it's easier to try new stuff and let the music speak to me. How do you approach memorizing/improvizing voicings when you are writing/arranging/playing?
053416.answer: seems a little thick for 1 chord .... everything about that feels frightening and all wrong to me, but to each their own i guess where are you getting these chords from? what world are you living in? oh no oh no this is all wrong does your keyboard have sound? make sure you are checking how these things sound because what you are describing sounds frightful just for some perspective, i've already mentioned that i think you are living in a completely alternate universe from me, and that might be ok, but, generally if I see Gb7 on the page, the basic go-to way i would play this (not taking any context into account), and if i am the only instrument (not a band) i would play 1 note in the left hand and 2 notes in the right hand. Left hand is bass note Gb (let's say the 92.5hz one) and the right hand is playing Bb and E (233 and 330). depending on context and what key the song is in etc etc you might need a little more (maybe add Db in between) but that voicing would pretty much be the standard for me. If i'm in a band and there is already a bass player there, do the same thing but skip the bass note i think you are overestimating the existence of 2 handed chords. if you are using 2 hands for a chord, your hands should either be very very close (like in the same range) and hopefully not playing more than about 6 notes max (beyond that it just gets crazy dense ... if you add more notes, they should be on the same notes you're already playing. which means other instruments have to play them) OR, you have a chord with your right hand and 1 note in the bass range. but only do this if you have absolutely no other bass player in your group oh you meant Gmin7. the example i gave before was for Gb7. --- Gb7 actually means Gb dominant 7 i've really never memorized anything of that sort. most of the learning i've ever done with regard to keyboard / chords / fingering, etc, has been a result of spending a very very long time with the keyboard in a deep state of experimental enjoyment. also i will mention again that this default idea that both hands are supposed to play a chord seems all wrong. the only scenario really where i think that would be a good idea is if you had 2 keyboards and you were playing them right in the same range and at least some of the notes are the same. the magic range where harmony/chords work is generally very small (within about 1 octave range). when you spread out, at least on the low side, you'll want single notes only (for bass range). and if you are talking about spreading way up higher, still i think you are going to find that this "each hand plays a chord" idea is just not sound. at least i think that's what you find when you start really paying attention to the sound

053465.question: 6.26.19 7:39 pm when i say G-Bb-D-F-Bb-C-D-F I really mean a voicing made of those notes bottom up, not each chord per letter. I was gonna write g-bb-f-d-bb-c-d-f but b for flat with non capital letter felt b for ti felt weird. I dont know if that makes more or less sense. And i did call Gb7 something wrong. I think its the Gmin7 with a "Bb add9" on top. so really a Gmin7 add11 with doubled 5th and 7th, but revisitting it it should be a Bb something, as so the F something should really be a Ab something. and yes i do agree these are separate universes, but i wont let that excuse me from doing things in a perceivably wrong way(regardless of how thick i want my supersaws to sound). I get too sidetracked for beefiness that I may be overdoing the voicings and cluttering the arrangement (and missing the tonal center). Highly truly appreciate you taking your time to go over my rant and bring obje ctivity. Now I have another point of view(and way more experienced) on my voicing approach or atleast cataloguing. Sometimes it feels like im working on a vacuum but im super grateful and lucky to be able to bounce these things with a way more experienced skillster to atleast have a sense of where the needle might be pointing as opposed to letting my subjectivenes or missfocus from sidetracking me into a least-ideal place. I hope my follow up made more sense and had less mistakes at essential points. . So the 2 chord thing i was describing once i take your advice into consideration would be something like Ab bass (the F at the bottom was really unnecesary, its really some sort of Ab) with right hand doing g-bb-eb, and then going to G bass with f-g-bb-d on right hand. How do you chose what to leave out when using many tensions on chords? Or it's a feel-along excercise with the theory behind the played voicings being an afterthought to analyze what was done? Upon yet ano ther revision my last version would be Ab (207.65) and on right hand g(392)-bb-c=eb which would translate to Abmaj7add9, and then for second chord Bb on bass (233) and then on right hand f(349)-bb-c-d. which would be a Bbadd9. Does it sound like a more balanced voicing? I did have a weird keys patch where i was jamming with it but going to a normal keyboard sound makes it clearer to hear what im doing instead of letting the reverb disguise the sound. It seems like by your description your instinct would be to go for bass on left and guide tones (3rd and 7th) on right and then alter from there?
053465.answer: i know ah, much more comfortable experience, knowing the songs, knowing what sounds happen when you use different combinations of notes. the only way to really learn is to spend a lot of time with the instrument, a lot of time with songs, and general life experience. you will even find yourself gaining experience in stores, when you hear something on the radio that seems great but very much on the high side. your bass notes are around middle C. this is cool, but if you are generally in the meat of the arrangement, your bass notes are going to be an octave lower (probably 2) and the right hand parts would be maybe half an octave lower. i'd say a nice happy range for your first chord (speaking in Hz again, cuz it's the only way to truly say which octaves we're using) Ab 52, and chord would start from Bb233 and up. a good range for the other one would be Bb 58, and C D F starting from middle C and up. that's always cool, if you don't know the song yet and specifically what it needs where. also it's good to practice shuffling the range around so the chord/harmony generally is situated around the middle C range. that's just where all the harmony wants to be. i think the more music you check out, the more you will find that that's almost always where the actual harmony is taking place. you may have many instruments helping out, but there are never actually that many different notes being played. the harmonic content is really usually in the middle C range and slightly above. that's just something that i've found over time. when you hear a dense arrangement with a lot of instruments, i think you'd be amazed to find out that there still aren't that many different notes being played, there will be a lot of instruments playing the same notes (layering)

053470.question: you said you we re going to change the editing software you're currently using (I won't specify but I'm fairly sure I have worked it out correctly). If so what to? I would go for either final cut pro 10 or premier. I know you can replicate your style on any editor, but I spoke to a guy who did a really good replication of your editing style on FCPX. Also, when you make your text, what effects do you use, I technique i use when i try and make editing like yours is to create multiple copies of one word/sentence in slightly different places, and use different blending modes on them, i also animate it by adjusting parameters on a setting i have called earthquake. Could you help me, I'd really appreciate it.
053470.answer: one of the good things about this transition is that it has made me more aware that the main software i was using is something that actually should be more of the final step. at this point, it is more important for me to have more animation centered software. for many years i've been kind of attempting to do animation on software that really doesn't do animation subscription pricing makes me want to jump off a building. but then again, the transition from fcp7 to fcpX invokes a very high amount of anger and bitterness. fcpX just feels so much like it's made for family vacation videos. even though i know it is very powerful (probably even more), it's just incredibly hard to escape the feelings of anger over the fact that the software you've used for 10 years has been deleted and replaced with something completely different with the same name. like they could have at least used a different name (iMovie Pro would be the perfect name). were they actually trying to trick someone? i think i've used all of them at some point, but it's a lot of custom made tricks the thing about earthquake effects that always bothered me is you can't slow down the frame rate it uses. i think it always looks like crap at the full frame rate. actually i was never using the 'pro' version, i was using 'express' this entire time. maybe the pro version had a speed adjustment for it. but my process for dealing with the earthquake thing was to actually to export and re-import and then speed adjust to 25%. and if i have multiple words appearing to be timed properly, i would make the sequence, increase speed to 400%, export and reimport, put on the effect, then export and reimport again, then speed adjust to 25%. but usually with that i use 2 different layers, 2 separate earthquakes, and also use overdrive on one of them (that also requires the speed adjustment trick, because it seems to look like crap on full frame rate, example, see 'print out my feelings') and then also use blend modes between the 2 layers, usually difference for that one. and then juggle it around until it's good. then sometimes export and re import that. actually, starting in mid 2015 or so, exporting and re-importing was kind of my secret weapon for getting things that look like they're way beyond the capabilities of the program. that's true for a lot of art forms. you can do it with sound too. put a bunch of stuff on something, then export it and reimport it, then mess with it more. then export and reimport that and mess with it more. that's really the trick for getting the 'how did they do that' look

053542.question: in my video editing program i can't figure out how to export text or other stuff, and then reimport it, but with the ability to overlay it over other stuff without it just putting it's own background on top of everything else. does this make sense? it would be very time consuming to, like, try to mask it all. i feel like i am missing a setting or feature?
