053565.question: 6.28.19 5:10 am First I'd like to say in regards to 6.28.19 5:10 am , I think my core confusion was that more=better when voicing (and then being too indecisive to know what to cut off for fear of dropping out anything "good" by dropping anything out and taking more=better to the extreme of 4 notes per hand for beef purposes, and somehow perceiving the chord root a third below where it was supposed to be for one of them, perhaps because i was voicing stuff so high that I didnt have a grounding bass sound, not trying to make excuses, just trying to pinpoint my mistakes and the core belief behind to more efficiently improve. Anyways back to chord talk.I really like that bass 2 octaves below, I find i rarely try going around those ranges when playing in my midi keyboard and it can really do a loooot to beef up smaller chords that may be playin g on rig ht hand. For some reason when I do go that low I usually double that octave but through listening to these clear examples i can see how it can actually unbeef the lowest note. Because if the patch im playing with say has any vibrato, tremolo, or even chorusing or other dsp, by doubling the octave you wouldn't necessarily get that extra punch at the desired frequencies because there'd be way more noise (noise as in many more frequencies besides the fundamental, not really all-frequencies-noise) because of the nature of timbre and that could muddy up the low end. I just realized my 61key midi keyboard doesnt go below c(65). When trying out the stuff you mentioned i put it an octave down and will be able to jam at a happier harmonic space. Going with your Ab 52 example going with chord starting at Bb233, I like doing Bb C Eb G and trying the second as u suggested with Bb 58 and C D F starting at middle c. Do you think you stray away from also playing Bb right below middle c wit h your r ight hand because of the most reasonable note to fit in a happy harmonic place within the context of the current notes is the root and its already in the bass? Trying to reason out when 3 notes might do a better work than 4 (again fighting against my now aware bias towards more=better). I thought i might add some more chords to those 2 to practice and get your thoughts with a bigger context so this is what i came up with to get a complete harmonic idea. https://imgur.com/Dx5oEck Now, i'm happy with all but my first chord, the thing about the first chord is that I have an alternative way, by removing the Bb. I like both but this is when my indecisiveness/whelm for possibilities/overthinking starts. I like the 4 notes on right hand as its the first measure and maybe it reinforces the one, but at the same time i think Bb could be better off not there for several contexts. To have a clear one, lets say we're singing never gonna give you up's f irst ver se. I also like Bb but no C. these would be the 3 variations im deciding between: https://imgur.com/3gKUMvN. I think it would make more sense to remove the Bb and keep C on the first chord and leave the 4 chords like this: https://imgur.com/mGJT4lj but tbh i find it hard to decide mostly because of indecisiveness and fomo on the other possibilities. Would those last voicings make the most sense to you? I really like the other 2 voicings but I'm not 100% sure of my choice of voicing it as Cmin with Ab bass (to make a Abmaj7) I was wondering to what degree would context have to change for those 3 to be usable or the most optimal for specific contextual situations in your opinion? Is my choice the most appropriate for a Rickroll reharm/voicing? I hope im not misusing/abusing the questions page. Highly appreciate your input and you taking your time.
053565.answer: actually doubling a bass octave is usually pretty safe, and doesn't really change the harmonic information much. anything else besides an octave, will be mud town. a general rule of thumb can be discovered .... whatever the lowest single note is that doesn't sound muddy, (let's say it's the lowest C on a 5-string bass, which is about like 32hz or something), i think you'll find that you can octave double that just fine without mud. and the next thing you'll find is that the lowest you can really go safely with a 5th interval is right there in the next octave: C64 and G98 will work fine together, and pack seemingly the same *girth* as the low C. and just the same, a fourth at G98 and C131, will be about the lowest you can take a perfect 4th before it starts to turn to mud. just the same, for the major third, the lower limit will be right here at C131 and E165. following just the same after that, the lowest limit for the minor third will appear to be right there around E165 and G196. none of this is a hard set in stone lower interval limit (these are called LILs in some social circles) but you can notice that they are easily a function of the harmonic series, which is what happens when you take a note and keep doubling the frequency. that low C (32), then C64, then G98, then C131, then E165, G196, the next one is actually a weird half flat 7th, and so on etc etc. interesting phenomenon but the point is that the lower you go, the more simple the interval has to be or else it will turn to mud, and then if you go too low then only 5ths will work and then if you go even lower only single notes will work, and if you go below like low B or maybe A? even single notes turn to mud. i personally think it's more like B. the lowest note on an acoustic piano is A and i really can't hear a note there, it sounds like a noteless grind you'd be fine if you played them both at the exact same time. the vibratos should be syncronized usually those ones have octave switchers 1 octave down is a friendly place to be on a 61 key keyboard if you are playing by yourself and you want to take care of the bass. super cool if you get a bass split, then you can play with just a drummer and a singer and it's almost like you've completed the band. takes some practice but if you throw yourself into a situation where you have to do that, you'll sprout wings! like jumping off a cliff. very fun yep, i believe that's the photo in the dictionary you should see next to Abmaj9 a fun secret of chords and chord playing is leaving out the bass note. sometimes if you want that extra thickness, fine you can have it, but i actually find when i'm playing by myself and i am covering the chord and the bass, i play the bass note in the right hand almost 0% of the time. actually much easier the think that way. there are a few cases where i do use it. and now that i think about it, most of those cases where i do use it are cases where there are still only 3 notes in the right hand 3 notes in the mid range, plus a bass note, is super great. 4 is super cool too. if we were to start listening to every song on the planet in random order, and go through and check how many notes are in each chord, in the mid and bass range, i'm pretty sure we would find that by far the most common case is 3 or 4 notes in the mid range, and 1 in the bass. that even includes the melody super classic. reminds me essentially of "you are everything and everything is you" and hundreds of others. this means you're in the key of Eb by the way. start playing melodies in Eb and you'll see that i mean. songs with these chords always have the melody in Eb yep well remember, you don't even have a melody yet. like you're making a movie, you've designed the entire set, and now you are worring about which flowers to use, but you haven't even looked at the script yet. let's not get ahead of ourselves. What's the scene about! only then will it matter which direction to point that little flower oh that's right, it's those chords ah, 3 more dictionary-like photos. of Abmaj9, Abmaj7, and Eb/Ab ("Eb over Ab") yeah, for that first chord it just depends how dense you wanna make it. which in this case will partially depend on what textures you have. but in general, the Abmaj7 will sound 'dreamy/longing', the Eb/Ab will sound more "shiny", and the Abmaj9 will of course be a hybrid of the two situations yeah, and it's important to remember we're splitting hairs here before the actors have even arrived, so to speak seems totally cool to me, but no one will know until someone has read the script. i.e. knows the melody and the lyrics i think in the rickroll song you'll need that dreamy C note under there and the Bb would be optional in terms of shine but most likely i think it would be Abmaj7. i'd bet on that being what they used. specifically i'd venture to wager that there is a good chance the G note was only in the vocal. (this is pending transpositions of course) also this is a good time to mention if you haven't tried this, do this same sequence but keep the bass on Ab for your second chord also. like Bb over Ab for the second chord. this would be exactly the "you are everything and everything is you", i think you'll recognize this cliche tear-jerking ballad sequence, which seems to have originated in the 70s (i think?) but can be heard well throughout the 80s and 90s and even today. especially in those sappy 'i miss you dearly' sort of feels. i think you'll recognize what i mean right away

053569.question: When I begin a project I feel super overly motivated and work super hard but eventually I always burn out, even if I love the project. I've been working on my current one on and off for a year and I'm forcing myself to finish because I've never finished anything. I would love to see it to completion and I love the project but I can't get myself to work on it. This might be a shot in the dark but any advice?
053569.answer: my standard advice for this is to try doing projects of a smaller size. if you are still having the same symptoms, just try even smaller projects. keep reducing the project size until completion is easily and handily within sight. i think you will find a lot of newfound excitement in actually completing something for once! and you will actually learn a lot very quickly. it's like when you first walk into a new house, you walk through the entire house once. even if you don't do anything in each room yet, just walk through each room. Now you know how big the house is! and you generally know how it goes! very powerful information, will pave the way for bigger ideas in subsequent episodes

053617.question: i remember watching a late night show video where a guest was being interviewed and at some point they quoted a song i think and started singing it in whatever key, and after a few seconds the band joined them in that very key. how does this happen, is there like a player with absolute pitch making some sort of gesture to the rest of the band or does each one start playing very silently until they find the key (i don't remember if there were any wrong notes at the beginning)
053617.answer: even if you don't have absolute pitch, you can get away with it. all you have to do is flick a note, and you'll immediately know what key everything is in. the other players may also do the same, and/or if the keyboard player finds the key they can tell the other players. if all the players know the song, then that's great. if they don't, they can fake it using intuition and try to guess where it's going to go, and/or make ambiguous decisions until they get it. also what is quite common, if the keyboardist knows the song better than the others, they might say numbers or give number symbols with one hand. you may never believe this, but i think all the skills necessary to do this are actually skills that are not particularly common among people with true absolute pitch. absolute pitch may help you find 1 note if you're in handcuffs, but in terms of finding the chords and the rest of the song, it comes down to musicianship/music, which is quite unrelated to absolute pitch

053626.question: Oh boy. I watched a video about chords the other day, and it was really interesting. The video made me realise that I should definitely learn more about music stuff, so I decided to download a free demo version of some random music theory book today. The book thing introduced me to basic music notation stuff first. I was doing fine and having fun until I came across tuplets/grouplets. I just straight up had a short crying session because the darn thing blew my mind (in a negative way). Like, how are you supposed to divide a whole note into three half notes??? A whole note is worth 4 beats, and a half note is worth 2 beats. 3 times 2 equals 6, not 4!! I'm so confused?!?! I just wanted to have fun!! I've even watched some videos regarding this topic, but I'm still not quite sure if I get the hang of it. I did try to make my own definition, but I think I might need your help with improving it. It basically goes like this: "a tuplet/grouplet is a group o f multip le shorter notes used as a substitute for a single longer note (for example a group of 3 eighth notes can be used instead of a single quarter note)" . Does my definition make any sense? How would you explain tuplets in your own words? What's the most important thing to know about tuplets? Also, where can I find really good examples of tuplets in songs? Thank you a lot in advance!!!
053626.answer: write 3 half notes and put a big number 3 above the whole thing right. the 3 is a cheat. 3 is actually short for 3:2 which means "3 in the time of 2" a good way to start is with the most common case: 8th note triplets. 3 of those will fit in the time of 1 quarter note. you distinguish this by putting the number 3 above them like this (sorry for messy, new computer, no new pen yet. old pen does not work. need a new pen) that's the way it's normally written, but, to be more precise, it's actually 3:2. (3 in the time of 2.) but because that's so common, people just write 3. You can do this with any note value. another common way to see it is like this. that's 2 16th note triplets and 2 regular 16th notes. the 2 16th note triplets are occuring at a 3:2 rate which means there's 3 in the time you'd normally have 2. Sometimes you might see a group of 5 16th notes under a number 5, like this. this doesn't happen too often, but i think you can generally assume that the 5 means 5:4, and those 5 quintuplets are taking the space of 4 16th notes. but you can know for sure by looking at the rest of the bar and seeing how much space they take up. Usually the only time you'll see the : symbol being used is when it's a strange/uncommon situation and you need to clarify the ratio. actually the most common place i think you'd see it is if you are in a 6/8 time signature, which kind of makes normal 8th notes behave like triplets, because there are 3 per beat, with no number 3 written. So if you want to put 4 notes per beat instead, you'd have to say 4:3 to say 4 in the time of 3. like this. this is exhausting. need a new pen

053714.question: Lately I've been OBSESSED with MBTI(Myers-Briggs Type Indicator)/16 personality types stuff so much to the point where it's actually draining me mentally for some reason. I've been trying to find my personality type for months now, and I still haven't quite found it yet. I've been doing research on cognitive functions, I've been looking through different MBTI-related subreddits, I've taken millions of different personality tests and it's driving me insane because I get different results every darn time!! I really have this need/desire to fit in one of the 16 personality types, but I just can't seem to truly relate to any of them (for example, I'm too dumb to be an INTP, not sporty/active enough to be an ISTP, way too lazy to be an ISTJ etc.)... Maybe I'm not meant to have a personality after all? Maybe there's a secret 17th personality type that I do not know of? Do these 16 personality types even matter? I have zero idea at this point. Do you have any advice on getting over this 16-personalities-thing? This is just getting out of hand, but I don't know how to stop myself from obsessing over it. Also, what are your thoughts on MBTI related stuff?
053714.answer: sounds like you already have it can be fun to try to categorize people. but i think eventually you will find that living things can be difficult to categorize, mainly due to their ability to change

053755.question: i've recently taken this approach to songwriting that's based around recording little song ideas whenever i get them and just having a constant pile of 15-second-long demos to take from and expand upon whenever i want to. this has been working fine so far, but i fear that the number of ideas will soon be so large that i won't be able to make all of them into full songs at a reasonable pace while also developing them to their maximum potential. do i stop recording ideas so fast, giving me more time to work on what's already there but also potentially missing out on what could be some great ideas? do i make them into full songs faster, letting me catch up to the rate at which i'm recording demos but also not giving me enough time to make each song the best version of itself? is there a compromise? do a take a different songwriting approach? help!
053755.answer: i think this is a fine approach, as long as you can learn not to be scared of how large the list gets. just understand that there are infinite ideas, and you will never get a chance to do all of them. once you understand that, there is no harm in having an enormous list. if choosing becomes a problem, you could use random number generators to help

053786.question: as I try to type this up it seems stupider because I can't quite figure out how to word it properly to make the distinction I'm worried about clear. But do you think chords have functions, or is it just notes that are functional? And chords that have a lot of notes with a certain function end up functioning like that because on average the set of notes ends up functioning like the function that is most common amongst the notes? Like, is V7 dominant because V7 is dominant? Or is V7 dominant because 7, 2, and 4 are dominant-function-sounding notes in the scale and they make up the majority of the V7 chord?
053786.answer: it's the whole sound combined, including any cognitive visual and/or linguistic information, which will overall have the true function it's more relative than that. it's more about the relationships to each other to be honest i have no idea why the word dominant is used to describe that particular chord. if anything really describes it most, i'd call it 'twangy', and it particularly describes the relationship of (for example) b and f notes (in G7), and more specifically, if you put G bass under that, it's called G7. the b+f creates the twang (due to their harsh relationship), and the bass on G makes it sound like a G major chord. with the twang

053876.question: How "complex" do you believe our human emotional responses to music are able to get? Are they hardly more complex than those of animals, possibly an ancient evolutionary feature? With this in mind - do you believe there are limits to musical originality/creativity and meticulous crafting in what appears to still have merit in a human audience? I personally still like to believe that we will always get bored and want something new - but could this "new thing" maybe just not be more than the "old thing" in disguise?

053900.question: I've had a YouTube channel since 2007 that I infrequently upload videos to and ever since 2011 I've been saying "okay - I'm going to get my shit together and make all these videos I have ideas for and get on a consistent release schedule." Every time I get my shit together, there's some major problem - like with an instrument, camera, software, or some other piece of gear. Lately, I've had the time and money to get shit together and ACTUALLY DO IT but I tell myself "oh, I can't speak in front of a camera until I can get over this bad episode of acne" or "I need to have this or that to make for an interesting shot". I've realized that my problems are partially in my head and I've been making excuses, procrastinating, etc... I know this is partially due to my anxiety problems - and I've heard friends (mostly actors) describe it as "being in your head". I say all that to tell you tha t your videos and audio recordings buried on your website that show a glimpse into your creative process - especially when you were starting with Vine - have really helped me and inspired me. A lot of that stuff made me feel like I wasn't alone and crazy whenever I talk to myself about grand ideas in order to sort things out or I try to hype myself up to get some creative endeavor done. Is there any advice you can impart that'll encourage me to do "the damn thing"? Or could you explain how you came to figure out your "process" and how to quit procrastinating and making excuses?
053900.answer: ah, you must complete the 12 levels of suffering, then the 13th which is the unlucky last and final level; the reason it is unlucky is because after you finish it you will be informed that there is another level after that

053980.question: Hey Bill. A couple weeks ago, I started making music. It's nothing crazy or anything, but it's just that lately I haven't been enjoying video games quite as much so it's something else to do. I kind of have two questions, though. Firstly, I was wondering how you start writing a song. For me, I've just hit a few piano notes at random until I heard a little melody that I liked just by coincidence and that's where I start, but it sort of feels like I'm cheating because I imagine real musicians put a lot more thought into their music. My other question is: do you think it's okay for songs to be short. I've never made anything longer than a minute. Maybe this was a weird question, I dunno. Thanks though.
053980.answer: any way. this can be confusing until you are able to convince yourself that you statistically might do it everyway that's the way normal, sensible people do it, and i only discovered that trick very recently. it works fantastically well, i don't know why i was ever so afraid of it music is everywhere. think as little or as much as you want. think a medium amount. go back and forth between the amounts and levels at which you think. there is music to be woven in and among any and all or none of those states if you want them to get on spotify, you're going to have to go through a lot of work to get them to accept it if it's under a minute. so i suppose at that point, the next question you would have to ask yourself is is it ok to not be on spotify

053990.question: hey bill what key is the song Help! by the beatles in? Sounds like Amaj but it has a G chord in it and that isn't in Amaj. If it is A major, where does that G come from?
053990.answer: i would say the intro is Bmin, setting up to seem like it's going to be in D, (hanging on the final A7 sounds like we're about to go to verse in D) but surprise, it's just not. verse is in A. this coasts along comfortably and normally in A, for a while. Then, when it goes "help me if you can i'm feeling down" this is essentually 2 parallel universes running side by side. according to what came before, this sounds like the 2 min chord. so the G will now sound like an interesting flat7. but by the time we hit the E7, all of a sudden you can re-map the entire last 4 bars (two chords worth) as if they have been in Bmin (D) the whole time. similarly showing up at that A7 hang about to put you to bed in D, which again it does not, it just stays in A. just does. to have the fun of going around and doing it all again

054207.question: Hi Bill. I just tried to transcribe a song, but there were some ambiguous chords in there. I also don't know if I am notating things correctly. Can you please check? Song (0:00-1:35) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vKdHdv6NGf4 Chords (4 bar lines) (Intro) 1sus 1 1maj9 1 (Main) 1 3sus 3 6min 5min7 1aug (~ii V I in key of 4) 47 1/3 2min 4/5 b5° 47 5/4 3min7 6min7 2min7 27 5sus 5 (Solo section 8 bar lines) 47 3min7 47 6min9 5add6 (Scales: 4Lyd 3Phr 4Lyd 6min 3Phr) 47 3min7 6min7 b7maj7 5sus 5 (4Lyd 3Phr 6min b7Lyd 5mix)
054207.answer: that generally looks pretty good to me, but the first thing that is definitely wrong is the "47"s, those should be 4maj7. besides that, to just nitpick the notation and not the actual content, when you say "5add6" i'd say it should be 56. (actually when doing it all in numbers like this i prefer to write the 6 higher than the 5, but that's not always so easy in text, especially plaintext like this, so i don't blame you). another thing, when you have the 1aug, i think it's most likely 1aug7. they're not doing us a favor with the release/cutoff of these chords being so long, the chords are bleeding into each other. Makes that flat5 thing much less effective than it could be, and difficult to identify because if we try to pause and isolate that moment by brute force, it's going to have the previous chord smeared in with it. But for sure plain as day to me that feels like a thing i always use, which would be a 3aug triad over b5 bass note. (not b5dim as you called it) so in this key, Baug/C#. if you listen carefully you can very clearly hear the E note (from the C/D chord) change to Eb during the chord. also, for more even smaller nitpicks, the 2min on the second line is 2min7. just noticed the first chord at the very top also has a 2 in it. so you might say 1sus2,4. and the 1maj9 on the first line i would definitely call that 5/1 (5 over 1). straight off the yacht

054209.question: RE: Not understanding why anyone would create software and not make every feature accessible via keyboard. Being able to click on stuff means you don't have to memorise a list of commands or even remember that Alt brings up menus. So developers implement being able to click File > Save first and CTRL-S later. Later never comes because the devs ran out of time or were bad at their jobs. I'm an amateur web dev and I'd never heard of this preference. The applause that followed your remark surprised me. Surely your niche opinion on software was not already widely held by that audience; as you had said yourself in what I believe were your initial writings on the matter, you felt that you had held this question subconsciously for a long time before you could express it. But the applause also made sense on a different level. I feel like we all hate the mouse deep in our hearts. Anyway so I looked it up and found out about the principle of keyboard comp atibilit y, which is similarly that all software should be accessible via keyboard because many people aren't able to use a mouse due to a disability. Not sure whether you knew that, but either way, it's a good opinion to be promoting and I'm glad I'm now a slightly less ignorant amateur web dev.
054209.answer: i never, ever said i was opposed to being able to click on stuff. i don't hate the mouse at all. it's one of the most important inventions of all time when it comes to using a mouse to click on a button, it is extremely inefficient to maneuver the mouse to the location of a fake button and pretend to press it. however, that's a great thing to do when first learning the application. but as you approach an expert level, it becomes vitally important to add the extra speed of using the keyboard. this is only for button-style functions ('do a thing', etc). this does not apply to actual graphical functions that require motion/movement

054229.question: can you finish prime factoring 1021
054229.answer: i think i left off after 19. next, check 23, we can use the triple. add 69 is 1090, drop the zero, 109 which i happen to know is prime (first decade of the 3 digits is prime-stuffed, i.e. 101, 103, 107, 109 are all prime) so therefore 23 is out. next check 29, add 29 is 1050, 105, double it is 210, drop the zero, 21, not a mult of 29. 29 is out. keep in mind we only have to go up to the square root of 1021 as long as we check thoroughly. 31 squared is 961, and 40 squared is 1600 so 37 squared is already gonna be too high. so 31 would be the last number we need to check. 1021 minus 31 is 990, drop the zero 99, clearly not a mult of 31. congratulations, 1021 is prime

054243.question: hey quick question, if i have a chord with a number, say f11, do i just add the fourth note in the scale to the major triad? if so what is the difference between an 11 and a 4? thanks
054243.answer: that's a weird example which has problems it's less about rules than you may think. it's like spelling. it's developed over time and there are some exceptions that don't make too much logical sense but that's how it's evolved. i will go through all the numbers and see if i can explain what each one probably means. F1 probably a race car F2 you might occasionally see this as an abbreviation for Fsus2, that would be notes F G C F3 nothing that i know of F4 you might occasionally see this as an abbreviation for Fsus4, that would be notes F Bb C F5 that would be a "power chord", notes F and C only F6 that would be notes F A C and D, optional to leave C out F7 that means "F dominant 7" which is notes F A C and Eb. optional to leave out C F8 i've never seen this used by anyone else, but i personally use it as a chord symbol for F and F (an octave apart) F9 that means "F dominant 9" which is notes F A C Eb and G. optional to leave out C. who knows, maybe even leave out A F13 that means "F dominant 13" which is notes F A C Eb and D, with likely also G included, and optionally leave out C. maybe even leave out A F10, F12, F14 i've never seen any of those used as chord symbols. F11 the reason i consider this a strange example is because i think given the pattern seen with F9 and F13, it seems that any number higher than 7 will mean Fdominant7 plus that extra note. so according to this pattern, F11 would have to include A, Eb, AND Bb. but it is commonly thought (and taught) that Bb is no good on F7 unless you get rid of the A. in which case it would be called F7sus4. However, one time i saw F11 in a book and they actually used it to represent Eb/F (which means Eb, G, Bb, with F in the bass.) in other words, F9sus4. I'm pretty sure if you write F11, it will be not clear whether it includes the A or not. I'm not sure if F11 is assumed to be shorthand for F7sus4. I don't think it's clear enough. If you actually want the A and the Bb, and the Eb, i would recommend saying F7add4. if you don't want the A, i would recommend saying F7sus4. F11 will be ambiguous on the question of whether to include the A, which is kind of an important question

054281.question: I've got some songs I wrote on guitar and I want to record them to record more of my music, but I feel stuck unless I'm playing on my guitar. Is it better to record the guitar and build from there or try to lay a groundwork and then overdub it for stable rhythm?
054281.answer: it's going to be a very different activity, playing/singing as a 1 person live performer (guitar), vs. designing an arrangement. both processes can be very rewarding, but they're totally different. if you're doing an arrangement i would not recommend starting with your normal solo guitar performance. if you're working alone, i would strongly recommend using a click and doing percussion first. then do temp instruments, then temp vocal, then go back and re-build the instrumental arrangement, then finally re-do the vocal, then maybe touch up the instruments then maybe touch up the vocal. where as, on the other hand, if you'd rather capture the solo singer-songwriter/guitar performance, i would suggest capturing as much room noise as you can

054346.question: 7.23.19 9:15 pm Hey thanks for the response bill, I figured that was the best and tried laying down a temp track, it just felt a little stale compared to the excitement of getting ideas for first time in a while and how good they sounded to me. is this just me being impatient to record and i should wait, or would experimenting with recording the guitar, adjusting it to tempo and then recording a final track of real time guitar?
054346.answer: these are 2 extremely different activities. it makes sense that you would feel lost trying to do a solo singer/songwriter 1 instrument+voc song as a full arrangement, and similarly it makes sense that it might feel impossible to take a full arrangement and perform it live with 1 inst+voc. they are completely different machines. the translation can be made, but it might take a lot of experience to figure out how the heck it's gonna work. actually what i was explaining before is that they are such different things that i wouldn't recommend trying to get one to work like the other. you might just feel confused and frustrated. in other words, i would say don't try to play the same kind of guitar track. probably don't even use the guitar, or if you use guitar don't use the same one and don't play it in the same way, and definitely don't do that first. i was recommending doing the percussion first. that's just something i've learned from experience. not the drums, not the bass, not the chords, but actually the percussion. like shakers/tambs/hi hats, etc. ch-k-ch-k-ch that sort of thing. this is why you'll need to have your writing all zipped up at this point, tempo and roadmap need to be finalized in order for this approach to really work. if you're curious as to how to learn how to run such a complex operation, i would suggest starting with songs less than 5 seconds in length

054475.question: why would you voice something in second inversion, like Bma7/F#, for example? does that all have to do with the chords and voice leading around it? also how would you voice that on keys
054475.answer: it just sounds a little different. you'll have to try it and see. actually i can give you a really common example of where B/F# really is what you want. actually let's switch it to the key of C for easier explaining, and it's not actually Cmaj7/G, this example is C/G, but nonetheless i think you will be able to see the difference. Take the song 'happy birthday to you' in the key of C. right before the end of the song, on the last "birth". the harmony is probably playing C chord, but i think you'll find that the best place for the bass, at this point in the song, is G. i can name a trillion other examples of popular/classic/traditional songs, over the course of the last 300 years, that have had a 1(chord) over 5(bass) absolutely thrive in this right before the end finalistic 'the song's about to end' spot. you've heard it a million times. try putting C over C there instead .... it doesn't quite fit. it sounds like the beginning of the song, .... right before the end ? ... By the way, to complete the example just you you can hear it clearly, the 'good' way to do it, from the final line "birth" is C/G, "day" is D7, "to" is G7sus4, and "you" is C, preferably with the G note left out, just e c , with low C in the bass. and Fmin/Ab was on "hap"

054512.question: Ive been on a nostalgia trip listening to music I was making 2-4 years ago when I was trying really hard to release my own stuff and then froze and didn't release/finish anything. The thing is, I hear them now with some distance from those crippling perfectionism days where I perhaps didn't have the skillset to close the gap of my taste vs my skill, and I actually enjoy the attempts, but looking back on the process I wish I could do the same things without my mind getting in the way so I can become even better and not have it be such a passionate swirl of good and bad emotions. Ive been trying to figure out what short form of what I was trying to do back then would sound like because I thought I wanted to try something new on my revisiting of music, but hearing those old tracks make me want to try harder this time, and starting small. Im just thankful that I still have those tracks around to experience my journey even though back then I didn't feel like the y were good enough for me to share because of the expectations I thought people had of me being the guy returning home after going to a great music school. Any experience with similar feelings and how you overcame them?
054512.answer: it's kind of like those competitions on reality shows where they make everyone get into a wheel barrow, and then they say "ok, whoever stays in this wheelbarrow the longest gets to keep the wheel barrow." ..... 054634.question: Regarding your AppleScript issue: I've had trouble getting my GUI actions to be recorded by pointing and clicking with a mouse. I DO get the results I want by outlining the keyboard shortcuts for the specific app. Good luck! AppleScript keycodes: https://eastmanreference.com/complete-list-of-applescript-key-codes Example used with my video editing software: tell application "System Events" key code 0 using {command down} # select all delay 0.5 key code 44 using {shift down, command down} # select top menu delay 0.5 repeat 3 times # arrow left over to Action menu key code 123 end repeat delay 1 repeat 7 times # arrow down to Templates
054634.answer: actually, the main point of this particular operation is to have solutions for those strange situations where there is absolutely no keyboard shortcut, nor menu item (if it was a menu item i could make a keyboard shortcut for it, but some software likes to go to more advanced planes of inaccessibility)

054642.question: 8.4.19 12:50 pm do you find that in those no-keyboard-shortcut, no-menu-item ones you usually get click static text? Weird question on my part, but have u made sure to have only 1 instance of whatever it is you're manipulating? static usually means theres only 1 instance of that value so idk if having several might trip it out, im just throwing out ideas while i understand more of the issue. Feel free to use me as a rubber duck
054642.answer: in many cases when there's no keyboard shortcut and no menu item, it often is accessible by applescript. but there is a specific kind of situation where clicking something in real life makes something happen, and the automator recorder claims that what i did can be translated to applescript as "click static text", and yet putting that into applescript yields "missing value." in approximately half of these situations, the parent item is "row", and if that's the case, i have found a secret solution of saying "select row." yes actually in all these cases there is a number after it, "static text 1" or "static text 2". getting rid of the others would be impossible because it's usually clicking something in a list, or clicking amongst a set of 'buttons', but it would be the only one with that number (i assume)

054678.question: With regards to the "Click static text" issue, it might be that the text itself doesn't have a clickable action associated with it. Button components have 2 visible elements to it, the outer bounding box, and the text inside it. In typical usage, a mouse click within the bounding box triggers the action of the button. The click action can be associated with the inclosed text, the bounding box, or both. If the text has no clickable action, it seems reasonable that "missing value" would be returned, even if it is able to find the text itself. Automator may have incorrectly assumed the click action was associated with the text instead of the bounding box, or if your program is particularly nasty, the click action may be just associated with a certain x y position on the screen. Somehow you have to get the name of the actual button box, and script a click action on that box rather than the text. If it is possible to script a click action to a x y positio n, you c an hopefully skip this mess, although as you mentioned previously you would need to watch window size/position or create different scripts for different work environments. It might be possible to script window positioning as well. Note: I probably should mention I have computer experience but not with Mac, so this is all "informed" guessing.
054678.answer: i've looked everywhere in "accessibility inspector", suspecting that it may be hidden neatly behind something. but i don't think you can move anything out of the way in accessibility inspector. but, i've found some pretty thorough scripts that extrapolate every possible UI element (or so they say ....) and gone through every single one of them and not found the secret button i'm looking for. so i don't know yes, i can do that yes, i do that all the time. and that does work here. but for various reasons i am definitely looking for something snappier in this case. i just really think there is a snappier way. actually i think there's some even better ways with jxa or swift or something to get way more internal and skip the UI, but i can't find ANY inspectors or recorders, or any way to actually learn what i'm going for

054750.question: Serious question: your music has a masterful way of building tension and then resolving it; using both clever chord progressions and cadences as well as melodic fills-- then it swings effortlessly back into a catchy hook or chorus. This honestly feels similar to how baroque music works. What is your thought process when you compose these things? Is it instinct, or is all of this meticulously planned using advanced music theory? Anyway, sorry for the long question, big fan and fellow musician here trying to analyze your style.
054750.answer: what works best for me is a door touch, kind of a superstition, re-setting my mind from a new listener's point of view, then play the existing song as far as it goes, with metranome, from beginning. then, at the moment when i reach the 'end' (or as far as it goes so far), that's the moment i listen very very carefully. only in that moment, after a clean run through, will i hear the solution. after a window of about 3 to 5 seconds, it gets much much less likely to get a reliable answer. at that point, i can do one of 2 things. i can go ahead and do another door touch and start again, or, if i've done too many run-throughs in a row and burned out the effectiveness of the run-through, i will try to play process of elimination. play detective with it a little. try to at least categorize all imaginable solutions. kind of like on 20 questions where they start by asking 'is it bigger than a breadbox'

054873.question: a very long time ago, i said something along the lines of, "i'm beginning to think that minor thirds are a very important interval. as in, maybe The Most important." and responded something like, "i see what you mean but you may discover that major seconds are more important." and my idea was--look at the minor thirds in a chord to see where it wants to resolve and how badly. Fm6 wants to resolve to C, G7 and G7b9 want to resolve to C, or to Cm, or if you get sneaky they might go to Am or A, or even F# in some cases. and you look at the common notes here: D, F, Ab, B like to go to chords with their root on C, Eb, F#, A. and a lot of things can be explained by this pattern of minor third series. so i thought about your answer and how maybe it could fill some holes in my theory, like how Gsus4 likes to go to G, or how Eaug7 likes to go to E7 before it goes to Am, but ultimately i do not understand why what you said would be true. i know it was a long t ime ago but if you could explain why you might have said that i would appreciate the closure
054873.answer: true in your first question you didn't give any specifics, you just said ' i think major 3rds might be like the most important thing in the world' . And i believed you, but also true is things like wheels, tables, apples, and so on, could also be similarly thought of as 'the greatest thing in the world'. and probably to have a nice good world you'd probably need a little bit of them all. What you just gave above is wonderful. this has nothing to do with what i had in mind about major seconds being so useful. Melodies come to mind, when thinking about how 'important' major seconds are. And actually, when you first said 'wow major thirds are like really important', my mind immediately went to melodies (you didn't specify what you really meant, like you didn't specify that you were talking about harmonic resolutions, etc) so yeah, i sort of had to guess what you were talking about, and my mind went to melodies. in which case i think it's easy to see why min 3rds and maj 2nds together are hugely important for that game. maj2nds being an absolutely essential building block of anyone's melody kit

054874.question: what's your opinion on wireless ear buds
054874.answer: latency hasn't come down enough for it to be good enough for things requiring instant response to user actions. i.e. music production, or phone conversations, or any type of game where it's important to hear an instant sound response to something you did. they're awesome as long as you're just consuming audio tracks (listening to music, not interacting with it) because once the song starts (half second late) it doesn't matter if the whole song is a half second late. Even video watching is ok, because most video players are smart enough to buffer it right so the vid syncs right with the audio. But if you're recording music, you're still looking at at least a 200ms latency. can't play an instrument that way. And this is not good for intimate phone calls either, because as it is, in the digital world, all cell phone calls have about half second delay (or more) already. And this gets worse when you're doing international, or internet calling. wireless ear phones will add at least quarter second delay on top of that. however, besides all that, it is truly awesome to have no wires. but i'd say the latency probably isn't down enough to discontinue the headphone jack just yet

054887.question: often times when explaining myself i feel like either people dont get what im saying or dont want to hear it, but that just makes me want to explain it further, entering a feedback loop of me wanting to make sure they understand, and them really not wanting to listen or thinking they got it already while I think maybe theres a deeper way to get it. Whats a good way to get over the feeling of having to explain up until the point one is convinced the other has heard to instead be able to get over it and move on. It can even be when giving advice, that maybe the other person doesn't want to hear or is not receiving well, i find that the need to give the advice can be more harmful than the advice itself since it can make the other person feel like they have a bigger problem than they do, or feel like they have emotional homework now having had pointed stuff out. How to know when one wants the advice vs not wanting it. How to stop going in circles when gi ving adv ice and not being cued of the fact that they get it, i dont even know what im trying to ask anymore. I'm playing this: https://i.imgur.com/qZVTEaU.jpg The last chord feels muddy to me but thin with any note less and I can't figure out if my only choice is to lower the bass notes one octave. 054914.answer: it's just gonna depend on the sound of the instrument you're using. i don't know any greater context of the song you're in, and this may give you a warmer sound for that last chord which may or may not be what you're looking for, but might i suggest swapping the higher F out for A. but that might totally go against what you're looking for, and i think it's more likely that you just wanna finesse the instruments a bit more. try a diff instrument, try combining 2 instruments, seeing which notes you can play louder or softer on each instrument and blend it differently. maybe actually just take out that higher F. and if you want more density you could go for the A, which again will be more of a warm and cuddly sound which may or may not be what you want

Many programs actually have equirectangular as the default mapping scheme for mapping an image onto a sphere. tutorials out there are plentiful for how to do this in whatever your program of choice may be. in fact, many of those tutorials probably use a globe for the example. Actually, i think many programs actually have a globe all set and ready to go for you, although i didn't find that at the time. i actually ended up swapping out the map mid way through production, for one with a bit more clear CC rights

055166.question: Hello Bill. which method do you think is the best way to organize your music? I have lots of music on my archive that i've collected over the course of 20 years and that i deeply care about (i hate all sorts of streaming sites). And i've put a lot of effort into shaping my music directory and now i am looking at it thinking if i can use more simplified method. My music directory goes like this: I have a main music directory named 'Music'. And then, this directory divides into the music genres, and then into subgenres, then into artists, then into albums (if there's any). Then you find mp3/flac files in those directories. If a song of said artist doesn't belong to any album (ie. single song, etc) it goes into directory named 'singles' in the artist's directory. Also, any songs whose artists i have only one song of, they go to the another directory named 'Singles' in the proper genre/subgenre. For example, if i wanna listen t o Michae l Jackson's Billie Jean, the path i have to go thru is Music -> Pop -> Michael Jackson - > Thriller, because i have the entire album. Or, 'Zhi-Vago - Celebrate the Love (Club Mix)' is in Music -> Electronic Music -> Trance -> Dream Trance -> Singles, because it's the only song i have of Zhi-Vago. When you look at it, it really is good method. All songs from all artists in the same genre is in one place. It makes it easier to listen in Winamp. UNLESS artist have many songs from many different music genres. That's the frustrating part. Do you think this method is good? How did you do yours? And your thoughts in general? Thanks.
055166.answer: no all songs together in list, organized by date added. played in random order, but searchable by name. would be useful to have it sorted accurately by date released, but let's face it, in a world of potentially infinite songs, the info on that is never gonna be complete unless you spend the rest of your life managing that i try to keep things organized as organically as possible in terms of the song's natural relationship with me. nature is the most powerful organizer

055201.question: Bill, what's up? Can I tell you something? I'm having severe issues with the VAST amounts of misinformation being spread mainly by vox populi and youtube/internet articles regarding music education. It's driving me nuts. One of the worst (and I tend to disagree on a lot of things), I think, it's about the myth regarding strength and exercise needed to play an instrument, as if playing guitar, piano or even drums required some sort of strong physical competence to the extent professional athletes do. I truly believe that playing and instruments in general (save some occasions and styles like flamenco or extreme metal, perhaps) are learned through very simple principles applied through musical concepts (or just music), with just standard physical well being (in the majority of cases already achieved) regardless of gender, ethnicity and to some extent age (and there tons of exceptions to my favor to th is too!! But let's play). I'm seeing people getting hurt trying to get better at their instruments the wrong way and it breaks my heart. I'm a professional musician and educator and I would really like to have your take on this. I think you are a true great musician and am a big fan of your work, by the way! Cheers! P.S.: Just in case, nothing against sports, exercise, fitness or whatever.
055201.answer: if you think they are really doing it wrong, you could try to show them what you think is a better way, but if they are not in the mood to hear it then don't worry too much about it. if they hurt themselves a bit later, hopefully they will be more interested in solutions then. but also be careful not to get wrapped up in wishing everyone played like you. it's easy to feel that way. quite often when i see drummers playing matched grip, i tense up and feel uncomfortable watching them. but in reality, it's 2020 and i think 98% of players are matched now. Or to be more specific, i see a surprising amount of players seemingly not doing anything 'moeler'ish whatsoever in their right hi-hat hand. meaning they're not packaging the strokes in groups of 2, in one single motion together. instead they're just hammering away with their entire arm, for every stroke, going through a lot more effort, looking kind of like they're trying to shake a baby or something. But still, it's on you to sell them on whatever better way you have. kind of like, 'hey, looks pretty tiring the way you're trying to pound out every stroke individually, .... well check this out' and then show them. If you sell it well, they will buy it. But it also comes down to whether it's really right for them or not. If it is, they will know, the first time they see it. and if they don't, then it could be time to start seeing other people. i don't really know, i quit teaching after 2 days

055267.question: Why haven't you made a video for 5 months?
055267.answer: the first week i was trying to make one insanely quickly. the second week i was feeling yet again bad and shameful for being unable to execute them at that pace. then for the next 3 weeks or so i was making the song for the video. then, when i began the video, a little tickle in my mind was telling me 'you know that little 3d program i use for occasional little bits of things sometimes, well maybe i should actually just try to start the whole video on there and see what happens.' then i had my mind blown in more different ways and angles than i ever knew existed. 2 months deep into this wild ride, it occured to me that now might actually be the most fine time to go ahead and do what is known as the 'finalcut transition', which long story short means i have to entirely abandon the primary video editing software i have used for the last 5 years. the reason for that is because it was discontinued in 2011. i had been delaying this moment for the past 5 years, because as i always used to say, 'there's never a good time to re-learn everything i know, especially because i've been getting better and better at it every day for the last 5 years.' But, here i was, suddenly doing most of my work in a different program which has the distinct advantage of being available on computers made later than 2014. so being aware of that, a spectacular cascade of events suddenly began to unfold, which i can possibly trace back to viewing a youtube rental of spiderman into the spider verse, for which the only way i could watch it was on a borrowed computer, because my main computer had finally become officially too old to play the movie with ANY browser. that realization, combined with seeing how much faster this borrowed computer was from mine (despite actually being the same age), combined with the outrageousness of the visual effects in that particular movie, combined with the previously mentioned reasons for being ready to make the transition, i decided to reach deep into the savings acount and see if i can make things a little more interesting ............

055289.question: 8.17.19 10:24 pm i have access to a bunch of mac laptops from various (2009-2019) years tomorrow, i will attempt to do some experimenting then. your first issue seems to be a glitch, but as to the second: have you tried following the directions on this page? https://support.apple.com/guide/console/find-log-messages-and-activities-cnslbf30b61a/1.1/mac/10.14 from what i understand, you first create a filter by right clicking to show or hide a process; the filter moves to the search menu. then, you click the arrow that appears next to the filter, which opens up a host of options to do things like "hide anything that contains xyz" or "hide any process of specific types". the pictures given by this page seem to indicate that this can be inclusive or exclusive, depending on whether the filter is blue or red. i don't know if you have the right kind of mac to use this fu nctional ity though

055291.question: 8.17.19 10:24 pm i don't know what exactly you're trying to do so this may not be helpful at all but things stop moving (at least on my laptop) when I scroll up past the newest entry? there's no way to stop new things from being added but scrolling up stops things from moving while you're trying to read them or whatever. as for hiding processes you can either control + click on a process and it comes up a menu option to "hide process x" or if you know what the process is called you can go into the search bar, type the process you're trying to hide and hit enter, then click the little "any" next to it and then choose "process" and "does not contain" and you can also save the search so you don't have to keep doing this every time, webkit i'm pretty sure is called com.apple.WebKit.WebContent

055338.question: when you record do you do everything in one take for each instrument or do you allow overdubbing on post production

055655.question: can you tell us what the "finder swap" is? i've been thinking about it for the past six months
055655.answer: that's probably when you are working in a content creation program and you change one of the files it's using outside the program while the program is using it. and watch all your subsequent work take effect now on a different, changed version of the starting file(s). this could be useful if the program is too bogged down by a heavy project, might be quicker to just make nudges to the files outside the program, where editing will be quicker and more responsive. and then swap it in and re-render. also extremely useful for making re-edits for different aspect ratio

055778.question: what is the difference between a piano and keyboard(instrument)
055778.answer: if you say piano, it might be the big ebony/ivory one with all the strings inside, popular in europe 1600s/1700s, and all across the world for centuries after. entirely acousting instrument. if you say keyboard, it could mean any other instrument that uses that same keyboard layout but is not a piano, OR it can be made to sound like a piano. OR a keyboard can mean any thing with a lot of buttons you can press, could be for typing letters, i'm using one right now, .... OR, here's another twist, sometimes if it's digital but it is immitating a piano, it can be called a piano, OR, you might still have to call a digital keyboard a piano even when it doesn't sound like a piano IF you are trying to distinguish it from one you type letters on

055953.question: i heard you have perfect pitch, but i also heard you started musical training at age 10 and that you are completely self trained. were you just born with it ? and has it ever helped your music making ?

055974.question: 8.29.19 7:34 pm How The Fuck?
055974.answer: it's RGB. the first 2 digits are red, the middle 2 is green, the last 2 is blue. it's hexidecimal, but let's pretend for a moment it's regular. higher number is brighter. so 00 00 00 would be no red, no green, no blue. so that means totally black. 99 00 00 means a lot of red, no green, no blue. so that's red. 99 00 55 means red with a little bit of blue. so maybe magenta. But all this is slightly false because the numbers are actually supposed to be hexidecimal. which means instead of 0123456789, it's 0123456789abcdef. so 00 is the least and ff is the most. so 00FF00 is full green, 0000FF is full blue, 0000EE is almost full blue, and FFFFFF is full white. 888888 is grey. 995555 would be grey with a slightly reddish tint. 'A' comes after 9, so AA5555 would be the same but slightly more red. etc

056124.question: Hey Bill, I had a question about chord names. If say you had, lowest to highest, C E G A Would you call that C6 or Amin7/C? C Eb G A Cmin6 or Ahalfdim7/C? (Amin7(b5)/C) And if one over the other, when would you use the other label? Much thanks
056124.answer: could be C6 or Amin7, but i wouldn't say "over C" unless the C was truly low enough to feel like a bass note, and if it is, then the other notes should be at least an octave above or else i would call it mush with no bass note it's not entirely clear, but by default i think Cmin6 is the most obvious way to put it the note under the slash is supposed to be a bass note. if it's right in there in the same range as the chord, then it's not really gonna feel like a bass note

056132.question: Hi Bill, I recently tried transcribing a piece, but the guitars were pretty soft and I'm not sure if I caught all the notes. Would you mind looking it over? https://www.youtube.com/watch?reload=9&v=qySn2yDBKUg (plays twice) 4 bar lines (Intro) 5/1 4/1 5/1 4/1 (rule the world) (Main) 5/1 4/1 5/1 4/1 5/1 4/1 5/1 4/1 6min 4 1 1sus 1 1sus 6min 4 5sus i1 17 4maj7 4min(maj7) 3min7 6min 2min9 4/5 1 17 4maj7 4min(maj7) 3min7 6min 2min9 4/5
056132.answer: those seem to be 4/1 not 1sus4 but close enough i think i'd prefer to say 57sus here definitely prefer to say b7 over 1 6min7 but close enough would prefer to say 57sus4, and if you're saying actual triads, then you might as well notate it because there's a couple different triads there, but good enough also i would say 2min7, not seeing it necessary to say 2min9, i'm actually not hearing that also, i might want to say, for those 4min(maj)7, it is extremely tempting for me to just call that 4min6, because that's what the melody is doing. whether or not the guitar is actually playing it as 4min(maj7) underneath there is open for debate, i defintely don't hear it the second time, i might hear it the first time. if i were charting this for a band i would definitely just say 4min6 just to make sure everyone's on board, the important thing is to stop them from playing min7 on there and min6 will certainly be exactly what's needed

056216.question: hi bill i have a HUGE list of projects and everytime i do a project it seems that i change my mind, for example i wanted to constantly do small projects or projects i wrote a long time ago but i can't find a satisfying way to "attack" my list. everytime i look at it i'm sad because some of the stuff i'm like, "this idea is awesome it should have been done already!". so i'm basically in a phase where i'm blocked and i don't even know why and it's horrible. i know you probably have a big list of song ideas so i wanted to know what's your view on this?
056216.answer: what helped me was to make a website. i was gonna use tumbler but i couldn't get the settings the way i wanted. so i started using custom settings / custom html. then i realized if i'm doing custom html i might as well make my own site. so i made a site, and i made it just how i wanted it. and i almost flipped over from excitement. then i filled it with everything i had done so far. then there was nothing left to do but to start a rigorous weekly schedule of new content. i had my lists to choose from, but i mandated that i release things 5 times a week according to a certain scheme. this was the result of many months and years of desperation, similar to what you described

056650.question: best way to edit drafts of songs? i have so many drafts. i need to make them into actual things right now they are like stream of consciousness stuff. or should i just keep generating content until i feel like molding it and editing it into actual songs? i don't know what to do or what i want except i guess to feel happier / more content
056650.answer: put every item into a list / inventory, so you know what you have. then, by some method, (chronologically, randomized, .... your choice), go through each one and open up a conversation about it, talk about it. think about the origins of it. and then just diagnose whatever seems to be getting in the way of it expressing that true original purpose. then start from the beginning, and keep starting again from the beginning and stop whenever it's not good enough. and keep working on it until the whole thing is good all the way through. sometimes you need time to pass before getting a new clean run through, but sometimes i can trick my mind into a reset by touching the door of the room i'm in, and returning

056659.question: where does your obsession with brass stabs come from
056659.answer: i've found it's the only way to play that fake trumpet that sounds any good. i used to not use that instrument at all, because i didn't think i could get anything good out of it. but in early 2015 i was doing some in depth experiments with instrument randomization (pick random instrument, THEN, you figure out (non-randomly) where in the song it fits. anywhere. beginning, end, bar 10.5 of verse 2, find a place to fit it in.) the trumpet came up, as a classic 'you're fucked' moment, but because of the nature of the experiment i was challeneged to find a spot for it, and there was one place sort of near the climax of the song, that, sure enough, it worked, played as short chord stabs. change my whole world up, and i've been using it in a similar manner ever since. usually having a tendency to find the exact only spot it would work

056667.question: have you written any other music since you started working on the video or have the past 5 months been solely devoted to this project
056667.answer: i wrote song, recorded it, finished it to the final mix. done. then started a video for it, but for some reason, there was a little voice in my head that told me to instead of using the 3D program for just little bits of the video, how about using it for the entire thing. well, for those of you who don't know, 3D video usually takes 100,000 years longer than anyone would ever imagine. but another interesting thing about 3D, is that it seems like the whole universe has just opened up. in ways that i have only dreamed about. vast new world. resonating strongly with filmmaking desires i've probably had since childhood but never admitted it, because 3D graphics has never really been anything that 1 person alone could really delve into, perhaps until this generation. so i'd say it was about 2 solid months down the rabbit hole of working on that music video, which really was turning out to the most exciting thing i had ever worked on. then it began to occur to me that now is a better time than ever to upgrade to a much newer system, because the reason i had waited was because my previous full time video software was long ago discontinued, and literally only worked on old computers. so i've been stuck on an old computer system for many years. given that i found myself now working on different software (the 3D one) which is not discontinued, it began to occur to me that the big shift is imminent. then a series of events unfolded that suddenly plunged me into the shift. and in the process, a thousand more doors and windows have begun to open. the possibilities are wildly beyond my greatest imagination. an interesting twist is, my entire old method no longer works on this new system (at least for video. for music everything's pretty much still intact, with all the benefit of the new system.) the old video system is still available on an ancient computer in the corner, but let's face it, the new possibilities wipe the old system off the map

056881.question: how did you get many keyboards working with your keyboard maestro, keyboard maestro
056881.answer: step 1, use Karabiner, but instead of swapping keys, disable all the keys (set every key to vk disable). that will be like 100 items to add and 2 pop-up menus each, so i recommend using kbm for assistance to get through it. disable the keys on every extra keyboard (not your main keyboard) then, in keyboard maestro, when you add a trigger, instead of using "HotKey" trigger (that would be for your regular keyboard) use "USB device key". it should come right up. as long as the keyboards aren't the exact same model, they will be recognized as different. Actually, i'm pretty sure that they will all be recognized as different no matter what. i've never actually tried to use 2 that are the identically exact same model so i'm not sure, but i'm pretty sure it would be fine. then, one slight problem you may run into, next time you restart your computer, if the keyboards don't work when you restart, just sleep the computer real quick and wake it up. then they should work. another side warning, if you do get this working, watch out for the binge-buying of keyboards that may occur as a result

057163.question: what if you didnt filter out stuff for reality and instead released all? then your content with regards to your self documenting can be as efficient as possible. 1 hour of work (minus logistic time expenses) = 1 hour content. I just recorded my first hour of thoughts (not trying to organize my thoughts but to think outloud entertainingly, entertaining myself pretty much and my thoughts, kinda the free form posts i can sometimes make here), and i keep thinking but can't really think of anyone who would be interested in listening to outloud thinking when its not for entertaining purposes. But I think maybe there might. Like, I turned on the mic and thought out loud it for 52 minutes and thinking of it being able to be as a standalone thing that's releasable. And I keep thinking but i think its maybe just a bit less tiring to do it without that extra minigame. Do you think that minigame should be the norm? that i should strive to be as entert aining/e fficient thoughtwise even when the mics off. Now if that were the case, wouldn't that make my aspiration to have every thought be content? Then how would I organize that, and when? I think maybe theres a benefit of only turning it on in certain times and be able to verbalize what has been inner dialogue only for a while, and that in itself can be an interesting display of words over time. I'd like to invite you to be the first listener of the first outloud thought session. (the whole what the hell is a podcast thing rubbed off on me which is why ive avoided the word throughout this, i realize i have a similar thing with "philosophizing", its just thinking really, the proper way perhaps, although thats already adding a bit of my biases). I think not thinking of it as a podcast would limit myself to thinking "you cant release 3 today!" If i felt like recording 3 outloud thought sessions in a day. because that doesn't fit my idea of what a podcast is, and that ma y bias the way i do what i do and how i do it or even worse, how i think of it. Turns out i came here to ask about why not release unedited reality footage but i really just wanted to talk about my first time doing something that felt natural since I am still riding that high. Hope you're having a bunch of fun and fulfilment playing around with your process and thanks for doing what you do and how you do it, i wouldnt be able to think doing whatever made sense if i didnt see you make sense of whatever you do. I'd normally go back and add parenthesis to afterthoughts but ive learned its more pure when the words are chronologically put where they are. Maybe not pure but characteristically something else.
057163.answer: that's true sounds like you are in for some very enjoyable times in the future. don't get too overwhelmed if everything seems to be its opposite on occasion

057712.question: Hey Bill! I'm currently trying to write a song called Birdhead, a long story about a man with a bird in his mind who bounces around his head, making him feel different things for the bird; loathing, euphoria, etc. But I feel as if I've hit a wall with the idea. I quite like it, and i've written a few bars, but the ending is absolutely killing me to write. From one songwriter to another, what's your process for ending songs?
057712.answer: whether it's time for the ending or not, the process is the same. start with a fresh mind, and play the song in real time from the beginning (at the proper tempo. use a metronome). just as you reach the end of the last known part, this is when the answers will present themselves to you. if you can, try to shut off the metronome within 4 bars of when you reach the end. pay very close attention in that moment, within 5 seconds before and after you reach the end. this is when the lightning will strike. try to gather as much as you can from that moment. then, in the following seconds after that, as the moment fades, start to analyze what you think you heard or thought of, and ask some questions to try to narrow it down. then, the only thing you can do is refresh your mind and do it again. the best way to refresh your mind on this is to not hear the song for several hours. but, not everyone has time to waste several hours between run thrus, so what i usually do is start the metronome, walk to the door and touch the door and then return and start. another productivity tip is to be threatened by villains

057884.question: Can you talk us through the process of writing and recording Just Did a Bad Thing?
057884.answer: yes, if i can remember. the first line had been on the shelf since maybe september? [checking] october 19, 2018. it was just the first line. then when it came time to pick a song, in december, i think i narrowed it down to about 20 songs and then my mistake was that i went through those 20 and narrowed it down again, and it got narrowed down to zero. so i went back to the list of 20 and picked the one i thought was the weakest. and it was that one. then i wrote it, very fast, because i was still attempting to do the 2-week schedule at that time, but i think it had already fallen apart by then. but i think i had convinced myself of some backup plan during that time. it was a long string of failures during that time, regarding the schedule. other than that i don't remember too much about the writing process. it was pretty standard. oh here's something i remember about the writing: the 'hey, what's the name of this game, ..etc.' all of that, after i wrote that i thought it was great but not right for this song. so i spent quite a while trying to come up with a plan B for that, and save that for a different song. i was really convinced that wasn't going to work for this song, as much as i liked it. then eventually i gave into using it. after that i think the writing went pretty smoothly and quickly. the recording process went slightly slower than some of the previous songs because i was just tired of rushing. it was probably rushed until i realized i had blown whatever the latest deadline was, then i was probably a bit more meticulous after that. and the release got screwed up too, because i was aiming for a certain date with the video so i sent it to the stores 2 days before that date, but couldn't finish the video. so the song hit the stores way before the video, by mistake. it was awkward. that turned out to be what the bad thing was

057943.question: How in gods good will am I supposed to play drums with a midi keyboard??
057943.answer: step 1, make sure it's dynamic sensitive (obviously) .... then, break the kit down in a different way: consider it more like 4 instruments. 1 is kick and snare, 2 is cyms, 3 and 4 are both percussion. actually 3 through 7 should be percussion. just do all the percussion first, and you're gonna be fine. quantize at 50% strength and add just the tiniest hair of swing, even if it's considered straight. you should be good to go. if you get hung up, do a little "writing" or pre-arranging: sit in a chair like you're a drummer, and pretend you're the drummer on the song. just imagine playing through it and figure out what you did. write it down and then put it together

057944.question: What goes the 11th harmonic sound like? I've been googling it but I can't find what is sounds like.
057944.answer: i'm not sure which is which, and whether the numbering you're looking for starts with 0 or 1, but here is the harmonic series, if you have a very low C (around 33hz). the next note is an octave up, (65) then the next G up (around 98) then another C (131), then something around E (around 178) that will wring perfectly in a chord with C (even better than standard E), then the next G (196) then something about halfway in between A and Bb (around 226??) (they are all getting closer together.) then C again (262) then something around D (294?) then another E which rings perfectly in harmony with C (327.5), then, this might be the one you're looking for, something that's like exactly halfway between E and G. so it will be somewhere between F and F#. 360.25. not good. then the next one is another clean G. then some more ugly in between ones. did we get to the one you want yet

058065.question: what does your songwriting process look like, in numbered list form?
058065.answer: bits and pieces may come to me at any time. need to be adept at catching them, recording them, and logging them into a master list, by date. then there's the selection process, for that i usually go through the whole list and write down ones that i am excited about doing. then, when that semi-finals list is done, immediately put it through a number-randomizer to get the final selection. then, when i have the selection, i have to play doctor with it. i have to look at it and make an assessment as to what the nature of that item is, whether it is the chorus, the first verse, etc etc. ... and evaluate what it needs. things get confusing if it's not the intro, because that means i have to work backwards, which can be very tedious. but if i just hang around and ask the right questions, i can get there. once i have the beginning, then it's a little more standard. just do run throughs from the beginning, in time (at tempo, with click) and then pay very close attention to the moments right when i reach the ending edge of what's written. that's when i may or may not be struck with solutions for what follows. then, whether or not it strikes, evaluate for a minute what the implications may be, then do a re-set, which for me is touch the door, and then run it again

058473.question: Hello I realised am addicted to quite a few different things. In order of addictiveness they are: Nicotine (vape. every 10 minutes) Caffeine (2-3 in the morning) Weed (every night and all day on the weekends) Alcohol (every night with more on the weekends) Fapping (every night and sometimes more) Takeaway food (5-6 times a week) These are the main ones. No single one is ruining my life (maybe alcohol and weed a little), but the main thing is that I want to be free and natural. Apart from weaning myself off caffeine, I plan to give them all up cold turkey at the same time for 30 days (except for Takeaway food if I am stuck some day). I can't find anything of anyone else doing similar. Do you think it's a bad idea to give up so much so quick? I am thinking of documenting my experience.
058473.answer: you could try it, but don't necessarily expect it to work. you might find that at least some of them will be easier to quit than you expected. some of them also might be more important to quit than others. but it could be interesting to try to quit all of them, just to see what the hell happens. it might be so much fun that you may want to start again just so you can have the fun of quitting again
